finding: The SNP rs73078758 was identified as a novel locus near the SLX41P gene with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.29 (95% CI: 1.18-1.42), indicating an increased risk of DVT. However, further replication details were not provided.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: Previously associated with continuous abstinence, the variant rs2236196 was the only one among the candidate gene variants to reach significant threshold but displayed an opposite effect in the long-term analysis related to varenicline.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The C allele of this missense variant in GATA5 was associated with lower FEV1 and correlated with increased risk of asthma along with several other traits.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs80339443 was identified as genome-wide significant for Chronic Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (CIDP) risk in women during the GWAS analysis. This variant is located in the intron region of the gene CDH4, which encodes the retinal-cadherin protein, involved in various cellular processes including neuronal outgrowth and muscle regeneration. The odds ratio (OR) for this SNP was found to be 4.37 (95% CI: 2.61, 7.33, P-value = 1.49 × 10⁻⁸), indicating a strong association with CIDP risk.
title: Genetic analyses of inflammatory polyneuropathy and chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy identified candidate genes

finding: The rs73598374 SNP, associated with the ADA gene, showed significant evidence of a correlation between the ADA2 allele and obesity in Latino adults, specifically those with BMIs greater than 25 kg/m2. This finding suggested that the ADA2 allele may be a risk factor for obesity and its associated complications like type 1 diabetes mellitus (DM1). No such association was observed in the Caucasian population.
title: Association of Adenosine Deaminase (ADA) +22 G->A (rs73598374) Genotype in Latino Adult Obese

finding: SNP rs6013897 was deemed significant in the intergenic region of CYP24A1 and BCAS1, with interactions identified through Hi-C data.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: SNP rs927059 was associated with femur neck BMD, with strong eQTL evidence supporting PAX1 as a candidate gene for this SNP.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs199806394 exhibited dominant effects, with significant implications for retinal thickness as part of the genetic landscape linked to ophthalmic disorders.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides epidemiologically informative biomarkers

finding: A significant association was identified between the MAVS rs17857295 SNP and the risk of developing IPA in HSCT recipients. This increased risk was observed when the variant was carried by the donor in a recessive genetic model, indicating that donor genotypes significantly influenced patient outcomes regarding IPA.
title: MAVS expression in alveolar macrophages is essential for host resistance against Aspergillus fumigatus

finding: The SNP rs2150165 in CBFA2T2 at 20q11.21 was associated with PSA levels and represented one of the newly identified variants in a meta-analysis aimed at understanding genetic factors affecting PSA screening outcomes.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Representing novel findings, rs291671 in CDK5RAP1 on 20q11.21 was significantly associated with PSA levels, showcasing the breadth of genetic factors linked to prostate cancer diagnostics.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Variant rs910083 was found to be associated with nicotine dependence in a trans-ethnic analysis including both European and African American smokers, emphasizing its impact on smoking addiction.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The BP allele of rs3829704 was associated with decreased expression of PRPF6 in blood cells (Lymphocyte P = 1.29×10−31) and in the brain (Cortex P = 1.20×10−6; Caudate P = 6.00×10−6).
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs910805 was found to be associated with reduced expression of the isoform ENST00000430571 (TCONS_00530677) of the XRN2 gene in both adult and fetal brain samples. Its G allele, also the minor allele, was implicated in this expression reduction, consistent with findings suggesting that this isoform's expression modifications might drive the risk associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
title: Multivariate variance components analysis uncovers genetic architecture of brain isoform expression and novel psychiatric disease mechanisms

finding: Linked to CDK5RAP1, this SNP was significant in revealing pathways related to addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The analysis revealed that rs76458410, located in the gene YWHAB, exhibited significant interaction with short sleep duration (STST) for pulse pressure (PP), with a P-value of 6.4×10^-7, indicating a novel finding in the context of hypertension risk.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: rs112958007, associated with PAK5, demonstrated significant interaction with STST for PP, seen in the Hispanic population, with a P-value of 1.3×10^-9, indicating its potential impact on hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs16991615 was significant only in females and mapped to the MCM8 gene, a missense variant involved in DNA repair, which suggested a unique genetic contribution to estradiol levels in women.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The SNP rs6031351 was associated with androgen receptor (AR) expression in early triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). In the context of the study outlined in the abstract, a significant finding was that a subset of TNBC patients exhibited positive AR expression, which correlated with shorter disease-free survival outcomes. Therefore, this SNP played a role in the clinical significance and prognostic associations of AR in TNBC, particularly highlighting its impact on patient outcomes.
title: Molecular Profiling of a Triple-negative Breast Cancer Cohort in India for EGFR and AR expression analyzed for patient outcomes showed a distinct subset of cellular co-expression

finding: The variant rs1203888 in LINC00261 was significant in the African ancestry cohort with a beta of -0.0423 (p=8.7e-13) but was not significant in European ancestry individuals (p>0.05). This indicated a potential unique association in the African population.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: At the 20q13 locus, the PLTP SNP (rs17447545) emerged as a new signal near MMP9, demonstrating independent risk association despite some linkage disequilibrium.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The rs1132274 was a novel missense variant in RRBP1, the CAD sentinel variant, suggesting involvement in endoplasmic reticulum protein processing.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The rs2207132 variant, sentinelling at the MAFB locus, demonstrated significant associations with CAD influenced by liver gene expression.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The rs1883711 variant was associated with the MAFB locus, although didn’t hold the strongest association initially yet had robust functional implications.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The missense variant rs530872363 G>A (p.Asp25Asn) in the RTF2 gene was found in affected siblings, both of whom had two copies of the alternative allele. Computational assessments indicated that this variant was damaging and conserved among vertebrates. However, it lacked prior reports in ClinVar and showed a higher carrier frequency among individuals of South Asian ancestry, reinforcing its potential association with ID despite its original unknown role.
title: Rare splice and missense variants with evidence of pathogenicity in consanguineous families with autosomal recessive intellectual disability from Pakistan

finding: The SNP rs13040884 was associated with elevated blood CCL17 levels in T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma patients, specifically in those with NOTCH1 gene fusions. The study indicated that all six patients with these fusions showed high CCL17 levels, suggesting a significant link between this SNP and the risk of relapse in T-LBL. This finding provided new insights into potential biomarkers for identifying high-risk pediatric patients in need of intensified treatment.
title: NOTCH1 fusions in pediatric T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma: a high-risk subgroup with CCL17 (TARC) levels as diagnostic biomarker

finding: The SNP rs2904106, an intronic variant in the ATP9A gene, was one of five critical SNPs replicated in the Pain Questionnaire cohort. It was also observed in Community 1, which showed links to the regulation of exocytosis and pancreatic beta cell function.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The SNP rs56218501/Affx-16805420, a missense variant in the SULF2 gene, was replicated in the fibromyalgia cohort, which suggests a strong association with both ME/CFS and fibromyalgia.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: Located on chromosome 20, rs4809823 was proximal to the genes KCNG1 and AL121785. It was identified as a positive original finding related to AD, highlighting its contribution to neural synaptic function and its role in immune pathways relevant to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Identification of 16 novel Alzheimer’s disease susceptibility loci using multi-ancestry meta-analyses of clinical Alzheimer’s disease and AD-by-proxy cases from four whole genome sequencing datasets

finding: The SNP rs56817213 on chromosome 20 reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.64×10−9. It was identified as a significant locus associated with suicide attempt (SA) in the multi-ancestry analysis, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for SA.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt in 43,871 cases identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci

finding: Previously linked to coffee consumption through CCGC studies, affirming its significance in genetic associations with coffee intake.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The CASS4:rs6024870-A variant demonstrated a protective modifying effect in individuals of Complex Admixture History ancestry when analyzed alongside APOE ε4.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs13040652 was associated with immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) therapy-related pneumonitis, as identified in the study led by Mallio et al. The research utilized a deep learning algorithm to predict the risk of developing pneumonitis in patients undergoing ICIs for non-small cell lung cancer, achieving a prediction accuracy of 0.823 and an area under the ROC curve of 0.895. This highlighted the relevance of genetic factors in predicting adverse effects of immunotherapy.
title: A novel prediction model for immunotherapy induced pneumonitis prediction based on Chest CT and electronic health record

finding: The variant rs117361510 in JPH2 was included among those impacting DALYs, associated with type 2 diabetes.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: This variant showed a consistent direction of effect between chronic dry cough and ACEi-induced cough, mapped to NTSR1/SLCO4A1, and confirmed the correlation with neurobiological processes.
title: Genomics of chronic cough unravels neurological pathways

finding: The study identified SNP rs143384 as being significantly associated with multiple inferred topics through topic-GWAS. Specifically, it appeared in a branch of the tree structure generated by treeLFA where most of the associated disease topics were clustered. The analysis reported effect sizes and standard errors for rs143384, suggesting it played a role in defining certain multimorbidities, which related to various health conditions distinct from those defined by single disease codes. This finding highlighted the relevance of rs143384 in understanding complex traits and disease combinations.
title: Topic modelling with ICD10-informed priors identifies novel genetic loci associated with multimorbidities in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11907908 was noted to exhibit a linkage (r2 >= 0.8) with ST-segment genome-wide association study (GWAS) sentinel SNPs, suggesting a role in the regulation of ST-segment amplitude, hence it contributed positively to understanding the genetic basis of disease.
title: An autosomal dominant cardiac arrhythmia syndrome, ST Depression Syndrome, is caused by the de novo creation of a cardiomyocyte enhancer

finding: Like rs11907908, rs2202261 was linked (r2 >= 0.8) with ST-segment GWAS sentinel SNPs and played a critical role in the genetic understanding of ST Depression Syndrome, making it a significant finding.
title: An autosomal dominant cardiac arrhythmia syndrome, ST Depression Syndrome, is caused by the de novo creation of a cardiomyocyte enhancer

finding: The SNP rs2229006 was found within the coding sequence of KCNB1, where the rs2229006-C allele demonstrated a 3.8-fold higher expression compared to the reference allele in cells containing the delinsTCCC variant, thereby supporting the hypothesis of increased KCNB1 expression contributing to cardiac-specific disease mechanisms.
title: An autosomal dominant cardiac arrhythmia syndrome, ST Depression Syndrome, is caused by the de novo creation of a cardiomyocyte enhancer

finding: The variant rs6062847 was implicated in increasing the risk of chronic dry cough. This association showcased a shared genetic determinant between ACEI-induced cough and chronic cough, linking it to the gene NTSR1.
title: Genome-wide association study of ACE inhibitor-induced cough implicates neuropeptides and shows genetic overlap with chronic dry cough

finding: The SNP rs7274134 located within the LINC01427 - LINC00261 region was identified as having an association with insulin resistance (IR). Individuals with C/T-T/T genotypes were at an elevated risk for IR, demonstrated by an odds ratio of 2.60 and a 95% confidence interval of 1.37-4.96 (p < 0.0032). This finding was supported by a dominant model analysis.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Indians

finding: The SNP rs6066146, located in the EYA2 gene on chromosome 20, exhibited a significant association with diabetic retinopathy, achieving a p-value of 4.21 x 10^-8. This finding suggested a potential role of EYA2 in disease development, as the gene is involved in retinal neuronal differentiation and vascular development.
title: Multiple genome-wide association studies of type 2 diabetes implicate several genes are associated with diabetic retinopathy based on UK Biobank

finding: The rs750318549 SNP in ASXL1 was associated with decreased lifespan having a p-value of 2.3 × 10^-15. This reinforces the impact of ASXL1 on longevity.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: Associated with TUD, this SNP is located in the CHRNA4 gene, reinforcing the involvement of nicotinic receptors in smoking-related disorders.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP in CHRNA4 was replicated from prior findings, linking it with tobacco use disorder in the African American population.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The rs6112068 SNP in DTD1 showed significant association with endometriosis, with a p-value of 8.72E-10. This finding was reported for the first time in this study, marking an important addition to known genetic factors.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The rs17265513 SNP, associated with ZHX3, had a significant association with endometriosis, illustrated by a p-value of 5.58E-09. Its recognition in this GWAS represents a novel locus linked to the condition.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The index variant rs1799990 in the <italic>PRNP</italic> locus was a common missense variant (p.Met129Val). Despite limited evidence from coloc or TWAS analyses, it was prioritized as a tier 1 risk gene. The heterozygous genotype linked to this SNP was associated with reduced risk of sCJD, though its biological relevance was complex and unclear.
title: Multiomic Analyses Direct Hypotheses for Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Risk Genes

finding: The SNP rs143384 located near the GDF5 gene on chromosome 20 exhibited the most significant association with knee pain, with a p value of 4.68 × 10^-19. This finding was consistent with previous studies that reported its influence on GDF5 expression levels, contributing to osteoarthritis (OA) susceptibility by affecting cartilage homeostasis.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs4809370 was found to be associated with preeclampsia/eclampsia as it represented a second independent association on chromosome 20. This association was identified in a conditional analysis in GCTA-COJO, with an odds ratio of 1.08 and a p-value of 1.4×10^-8, highlighting its significance in the context of hypertensive disorders of pregnancy.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis identifies novel maternal risk variants and enables polygenic prediction of preeclampsia and gestational hypertension

finding: The allele variant rs6070628 within MIR298 demonstrated a correlation with higher cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) levels of phosphorylated-tau181 in a dose-dependent manner. This association was significant as it indicated a relationship between miRNA polymorphisms and tau pathology, an important feature of neurodegenerative diseases, including Alzheimer's disease.
title: A multi-omics approach identifies a blood-based miRNA signature of cognitive decline in two large observational trials

finding: SNP rs259983 was identified as one of the five maternally derived variants associated with preeclampsia (PE) that also predisposed individuals to hypertension (HTN), supporting the idea of shared genetic risk between HTN and PE.
title: Spatially Constrained Gene Regulation Identifies Key Genetic Contributions of Preeclampsia, Hypertension and Proteinuria

finding: rs45577437 was noted as exonic to the ZNF341 gene on chromosome 20q11.22, with a significant association to CAP (p=1.21×10⁻¹⁴). The variant predicted a missense change in the protein, indicating a potential biological impact.
title: A genome-wide association study of adults with community-acquired pneumonia

finding: The rs150607032 variant, mapped to ATP9A/NFATC2/SALL4, showed strong association with TG levels influenced by short total sleep time (STST), emphasizing its relevance in the interaction of sleep duration with lipid levels.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The rs73319497 variant, located within the GZF1/NPAB/CASTL1/CAST11/NXT1 region, was found to be associated with TG under short total sleep time (STST), illustrating its significance in lipid regulation relative to sleep patterns.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: This SNP was associated with a genetic locus affecting immune cell functionalities, revealing its importance in the context of immunity.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: The rs2876034 variant was associated with a reduced risk of COVID-19 hospitalization (OR=0.95, 95% CI=0.93-0.97, p=2.83×10^-8) and was found to be in strong LD with rs2326788, a sentinel variant for critical COVID-19.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: This variant served as a sentinel for the CASC20 locus associated with critical COVID-19 implications, thereby confirming its relevance in severity outcomes.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The SNP rs6120777, associated with MYH7B, was found to be significant in the context of familial hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. The association remained even after excluding cases with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, indicating its relevance in general cardiac hypertrophy.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs191456206 was located 1 base pair upstream of the CpG site cg22798925 within the GNAS gene. This site was significantly associated with prenatal depression scores based on the EPDS scale. The GNAS gene is known to have various promoters and plays a significant role in genomic imprinting and hormone pathways. The major allele for this SNP was G, while the minor alleles C and T were rare, with allele frequencies of 1.6 x 10^-5 for C and 0.0 for T. Given GNAS's role in fetal development and its association with maternal exposures, this finding highlights its importance in researching the link between prenatal depression and adverse developmental outcomes in children.
title: Association between Maternal Depression during Pregnancy and Newborn DNA Methylation

finding: Found at the 20q13.33 locus, rs11697662 was described as having an independent association with lung cancer and was indicated as an eQTL for the CHRNA4 nicotinic acetylcholine receptor subunit across multiple tissues.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The variant rs2232613 was associated with significantly reduced levels of the LBP protein, highlighting its relevance in protein expression modulation in the context of liver health.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: The association for craniosynostosis was replicated with rs1124471 at nominal significance in the Latino analysis (p=1.98e-4, MAF=0.37, OR=2.33).
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The SNP rs74828248 was found to be significantly associated with TB susceptibility in the admixed South African population, as reported through the local ancestry allelic adjusted association (LAAA) model. The association reached a p-value of 2.272 x 10^-6 with an odds ratio of 0.316, although the connection to TB risk was less clear as this variant resided in an intergenic region.
title: Confirmation of HLA-II associations with TB susceptibility in admixed African samples

finding: pgBoost linked rs2295348 to RNF24, which is fine-mapped for mean corpuscular volume with a PIP of 0.58. The SNP lies in an ENCODE cCRE with a distal enhancer signature within an intron of CDC25B. Although not experimentally validated, RNF24 was suggested as a biologically plausible target gene based on knockout studies.
title: Linking regulatory variants to target genes by integrating single-cell multiome methods and genomic distance

finding: SNP rs8124182 influenced MMP9 plasma protein levels specifically in STEMI patients, with a genotype effect of β=-0.68 and a p-value of 0.016. This finding indicated that this SNP's impact was disease-specific, highlighting the necessity of considering genetic factors in the context of acute myocardial infarction.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: This SNP was associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs1883832 was identified in a GWAS involving a sample of 109 ancestrally homogeneous subjects. It was implicated as a functional SNP located in the Kozak sequence of the CD40 gene, which encodes a receptor central to immune and inflammatory responses.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The SNP rs13040687 was identified in the context of the study investigating the causal relationship between tuberculosis (TB) and lung cancer (LC). It was implicated in the mediating effects of immune cells, specifically within the immune phenotype CD4 on CD39+ resting regulatory T cells, which showed a mediation proportion of 9.09%. This finding suggested a significant role of this SNP in the increased risk of LC associated with TB.
title: Integrating immunophenotypes reveals causal relationship between tuberculosis and lung cancer: Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs143384 was shown to co-localize with mQTL cg12548730, which mapped to the gene GDF5. It was associated with lower DNA methylation levels in the presence of the OA effect allele G. This locus was linked to phenotypes including All OA and Total Joint Replacement.
title: Epigenetic mechanisms of osteoarthritis risk in human skeletal development

finding: The SNP rs6062302 was strongly associated with glioblastoma and had a genome-wide significance level of P = 1.00 x 10^-13. It was part of a group of SNPs linked to glioma risk as well.
title: Multi-omics Mendelian randomisation using expression, splicing and protein quantitative trait loci: identification of novel drug targets for gliomagenesis

finding: The SNP rs2297440 showed strong associations with glioblastoma (P = 4.00 x 10^-46) and glioma (P = 2.00 x 10^-42), confirming its role as a significant risk factor for these conditions.
title: Multi-omics Mendelian randomisation using expression, splicing and protein quantitative trait loci: identification of novel drug targets for gliomagenesis

finding: The SNP rs6063202 was found to be strongly associated with glioblastoma (P = 1.00 x 10^-13) and also linked to allergy-related traits, demonstrating its potential dual relevance in immune-related conditions and glioma.
title: Multi-omics Mendelian randomisation using expression, splicing and protein quantitative trait loci: identification of novel drug targets for gliomagenesis

finding: rs348258, situated at chr20q13.13, was also significantly associated with reading ability, surpassing the significance seen in prior studies related to dyslexia, aligning it as a top loci finding.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: As a tag SNP predicted to have damaging consequences, rs1130146 was recognized for its potential influence on cognitive traits related to reading.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: Linked to stop gain changes and achieving a significance indicating association with reading ability, rs2424922 was included in analyses emphasizing its complex trait relevance.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: The variant rs143384 was found more frequently in Africans (0.92) compared to Europeans (0.40), with a p-value of 2.0 × 10<sup>−323</sup>. This SNP had previously been reported associated with FVC, lung function, and PEF.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The study revealed that the SNP rs1883832 was strongly associated with the risk of multiple sclerosis (MS) with a p-value of 1.07 x 10^{-281}. This SNP was identified as a cis-expression quantitative trait locus (cis-pQTL) for plasma CD40, with the C allele corresponding to increased CD40 levels in blood and the cerebral cortex. Moreover, previous studies indicated the involvement of the CD40-CD40L pathway in the pathogenesis of MS.
title: Circulating inflammatory proteins and risk of Parkinson’s disease and other neurodegenerative disorders: a two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was linked to the PHF20 gene, with a notable p-value of 6.62×10<sup>−5</sup> in the MTAG-CES analysis compared to 6.05×10<sup>−4</sup> in the MEGASTROKE-CES analysis.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: This SNP was novel in association with the KIAA1755 gene, and it reached significance in the MTAG-CES analysis with a missense variant resulting in R1045W, which was predicted to be deleterious with a SIFT score of 0.007.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: The SNP rs13040909 was linked to the regulation of the enzyme PFKFB3, which was found to be elevated in rheumatoid arthritis (RA) neutrophils, thereby influencing reactive oxygen species (ROS) and neutrophil extracellular trap (NET) production. This finding highlights the role of metabolic regulation in neutrophil functions, particularly in conditions characterized by dysregulated activation like RA.
title: The small molecule inhibitor 3PO is a modulator of neutrophil metabolism, ROS production and NET release

finding: The rs73149254 variant in the 3' UTR of GATA5 was associated with VT recurrence, approaching significance with HR of 1.75 (95% CI: 1.42-2.16, P=1.68x10^-7). The GATA5 gene is crucial in angiogenesis and endothelial function.
title: Genomic Landscape of Thrombosis Recurrence Risk Across Venous Thromboembolism Subtypes

finding: This SNP near BCL2L1 was significant for mLOY in both African and European ancestry groups, with an Odds Ratio of 0.798 indicating a protective effect, highlighted by significant differences in allele frequencies between ancestries.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of mosaic loss of chromosome Y in the Million Veteran Program identifies 167 novel loci

finding: The coding variant rs1799990 (M129V) was found to have substantial effects on prion disease risk, clinical presentation, and histopathology. Specifically, it offered strong protection against sporadic CJD, with a genotypic odds ratio of 0.39 and a highly significant p-value (P = 1e-135). However, there was no significant correlation found between CSF PrP levels in MM and MV individuals within the cohort, with p-values of 0.06 and 0.18, suggesting that this SNP's major contribution was not to CSF PrP concentration.
title: PrP concentration in the central nervous system: regional variability, genotypic effects, and pharmacodynamic impact

finding: The rs13039273 SNP located at 20q13.31 was associated with an increased risk of uterine leiomyomata (UL). The risk-increasing allele, C, correlated with lower expression of RNA binding motif protein 38 (RBM38) in the ovary and uterus. This association underscores the regulatory role of RBM38 on the stability of CDKN1A transcripts, which are known to influence UL size.
title: Evidence of a causal relationship between genetic tendency to gain muscle mass and uterine leiomyomata

finding: The rs760640162 SNP, found at 20q13.31, was previously linked to 'pregnancy examination and test' with a significant p-value in the UK Biobank, suggesting its potential relevance to uterine leiomyomata (UL) biology. This variant might influence phenotypic expressions related to pregnancy, which could be indirectly connected to the risk factors involving UL.
title: Evidence of a causal relationship between genetic tendency to gain muscle mass and uterine leiomyomata

finding: The SNP rs58744877 near GNAS was implicated in FVC, showing a P-value of 2.71x10^-14 and a beta of -0.033, marking a novel association in the context of respiratory function.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: This non-synonymous variant in the MCM8 gene was found to be significantly associated with AMH levels with a p-value of 4.68 x 10^-9, reinforcing previous reports linking it to AMH regulation.
title: Circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women: novel genetic insights from a GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs16980973 was found to be significantly associated with neck or shoulder pain, with a p-value of 6.52 x 10^-9, located in the SLC24A3 gene on chromosome 20 from the male-specific GWAS. This locus suggests a unique genetic component of neck or shoulder pain in males.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Neck or Shoulder Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The rs150246290 SNP was associated with the phenotype of transposition of the great arteries. It was replicable in the context of Peds-Phecode 747.1113 'Transposition of great vessels', showcasing concordant effect directionality and significant association.
title: Developing and Evaluating Pediatric Phecodes (Peds-Phecodes) for High-Throughput Phenotyping Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The causal inferences of the level of CD33 on CD33<sup>dim</sup> HLA DR<sup>-</sup> were significantly driven by rs1884673, indicating its critical role in immune profiling.
title: Causal effect of the gut microbiota on the risk of psychiatric disorders and the mediating role of immunophenotypes

finding: The functional polymorphism rs3918242 of the MMP9 gene was found to be more common in individuals with bipolar disorder (BD) compared to healthy controls. The statistical analysis reported a p-value of 0.02, indicating a significant association between this SNP and BD.
title: The Blood-Brain Barrier in Bipolar Disorders: A Systematic Review

finding: The SLC52A3 gene SNP rs6140149 was newly associated with vitamin B2 levels, indicating its role in vitamin metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The study mentioned rs1883832 as a noteworthy cis-eQTL for CD40, with substantial evidence for colocalization across distinct tissues.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: For rs6032259, a significant association with Kunitz-type protease inhibitor 3 (SPIT3) was found. SPIT3 was reported to be predominantly expressed in epididymis, although its specific biological functions regarding male fertility were not clearly established.
title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs867186 at the PROCR gene indicated that this SNP was correlated with a higher risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE) but a lower risk of coronary artery disease (CAD). This correlation was consistent with previous GWAS studies, which suggested that the minor G allele of rs867186 played a significant role in influencing the risk associated with these vascular conditions. Additionally, PROCR was identified as being positively associated with venous disorders, illustrating its complex role in cardiovascular disease mechanisms as it might link CAD through anti-inflammatory mechanisms and VTE through pro-thrombotic mechanisms.
title: Blood plasma proteome-wide association study implicates novel proteins in the pathogenesis of multiple cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs2284265 was associated with BMI within 500kb of the HNF4A gene, with a beta of 0.012 and significance of P = 4.8 × 10^-8.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: SNP rs12625671 showed a connection with T2D within 500kb of the HNF4A gene, presenting a significant beta of 0.067 and a P value of 1.7 × 10^-68.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: This SNP was associated with unilateral versus bilateral clefts, achieving genome-wide significance (p = 7.53×10⁻⁹) and indicated higher odds of BCL compared to UCL, emphasizing its role as a potential modifier for cleft severity.
title: The PAX1 locus at 20p11 is a modifier for bilateral cleft lip only

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant modifier in a replication cohort for the cleft lip cases, with an odds ratio of 3.83 (95% CI = 1.64-8.95, p = 0.0018), further confirming its association with cleft lip severity.
title: The PAX1 locus at 20p11 is a modifier for bilateral cleft lip only

finding: Located in the 20p11 region, this SNP was linked to normal nasal morphology (p = 2.63×10⁻¹¹) and demonstrated association with the projection of the nasal tip and columella, establishing a connection between genetic variation and cleft morphology.
title: The PAX1 locus at 20p11 is a modifier for bilateral cleft lip only

finding: The SNP rs72626599, located within the NKILA-MIR4532 region, presented a strong association with early-onset gout, with a P-value of 6.48 × 10^-9 and an odds ratio of 1.58.
title: Novel genetic loci in adolescent-onset gout derived from whole genome sequencing of a Chinese cohort

finding: The SNP rs1799990 was identified as the outstanding genome-wide determinant of clinical duration in sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD), achieving a genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.45×10^-36 and a beta value of 0.34 for the additive model. In a heterozygous model, it reached a p-value of 9.92×10^-67 with a beta of 0.84, indicating its strong association with clinical duration. This finding highlighted the role of the well-known non-synonymous variant at codon 129 as a key genetic determinant of disease progression.
title: Genome wide association study of clinical duration and age at onset of sporadic CJD

finding: The analysis revealed a SABR-specific sQTL for KIF16B (rs138620712), which is a predicted splice donor variant present at 2.1% in SABR and absent from 1000 Genomes Africans, with a significance of p = 3.36e-28 and a beta of 2.03.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The variant rs17800010 associated with C20orf187 (LINC02871) was identified on 20p12.2, linked to risks for lung cancer and has prior associations with bladder carcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Located near BTBD3 on chromosome 20p12.2, rs140412956 demonstrated significant associations with lung cancer and adenocarcinoma, particularly affecting Asian populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: A rare intergenic variant rs138934990 at CBLN4-LINC01441 on 20q13.2 was associated across all ethnicities, showcasing a broader impact on lung cancer risk.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The ncRNA intronic variant rs75031349 near RTEL1 was associated with atelectasis, confirming the underlying risks linked to telomere regulation.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs45552131 was associated with multiple microRNAs (miR-1, miR-133a-3p, and miR-133b), which were shown to replicate previous findings and indicated their involvement in regulatory processes related to insulin signaling.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The rs6088765-G variant in PROCR/MMP24 was associated with a decreased risk of NMSC (OR 0.95, 95% CI 0.91, 0.99) and was noted to also decrease the risk of non-melanoma skin cancer (MSC) showing a complex role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The SNP rs1799990, located at codon 129 of the PRNP gene, had findings that indicated that homozygosity at this position was associated with an increased risk of developing sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD). Additionally, it correlated with shorter survival times when compared to heterozygotes. This SNP was identified as a significant determinant of clinical phenotype in prion disease cases.
title: Prion protein gene mutation detection using long-read Nanopore sequencing

finding: The SNP rs3746444 was found to be significantly associated with an increased risk of CHD. It showed strong statistical significance using various models, including the co-dominant model (P = 0.0001) and the dominant model (OR = 9.333; P = 0.0001), indicating that it could serve as a risk factor for CHD.
title: The potential impact of microRNA-related functional polymorphisms in the pathogenesis of coronary heart disease

finding: This SNP, found in the PK59 cell line with a GALC mutation, was associated with lysosome dysfunction in PDAC. Its presence in this particular cell line indicated its potential role in the impaired autophagolysosome activity that characterizes certain PDAC cases.
title: Lysosomal Storage Dysfunction, a Germline Variants Affecting Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma Development and Progression

finding: The SNP rs6032660 was found to be associated with overlapping causal relationships involving PTSD and cardiovascular health indicators.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: Rs4809327 in the ZGPAT gene showed strong associations with FEV1 percent predicted, FVC, and wheeze (p value <0.5×10−8), along with weaker associations with self-reported asthma.
title: Epidemiology and Genetics of Preserved Ratio Impaired SpiroMetry (PRISm): An Analysis of UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs6088962, also located at 20q11.21, was identified as a neighboring locus associated with schizophrenia (SCZ1) and co-localized with rs3068507. Like rs3068507, it mapped to the MYLK2 gene, indicating shared biological pathways between these conditions.
title: Neuroimaging-AI Endophenotypes of Brain Diseases in the General Population: Towards a Dimensional System of Vulnerability

finding: Linked to expression levels in CPNE1 with significant implications in genetic correlation with protein levels.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The SNP rs13040718 was highlighted in the context of adiposity traits and their relationship to endometrial cancer (EC). Specifically, a higher body mass index (BMI), which was associated with this SNP, was linked to an increased risk of overall EC, including its endometrioid and non-endometrioid subtypes. The findings suggested that metabolites associated with this SNP potentially played an intermediate role between elevated BMI and increased EC risk.
title: Adiposity, metabolites and endometrial cancer risk: Mendelian randomization and Observational analyses

finding: The variant rs6127099, found around 50kb downstream of CYP24A1, exhibited an odds ratio of 11.42 for increased kidney stone disease risk associated with a 1 standard deviation increase in serum calcium. This indicated a potential link to impaired vitamin D inactivation.
title: Genetic variants predisposing to increased risk of kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs143383 located in the GDF5 gene was associated with Hip Axis Length (HAL) in the Shanghai Changfeng cohort with a highly significant P value of 9.4×10^-10. This finding was replicated in the Core cohort, demonstrating its relevance to hip morphology as well as its previously reported associations with osteoarthritis (OA) and developmental dysplasia of the hip (DDH).
title: Genome-wide association study of DXA-derived hip morphology identifies associations with 4 loci in Chinese populations

finding: The SNP rs16991615, a missense variant in exon 9 of the MCM8 gene, was confirmed to associate with circulating AMH levels and with natural age at menopause. This locus was the only previously identified variant in relation to AMH levels and also suggested a role in ovarian function.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis identifies three novel loci for circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in women

finding: The SNP rs6032676 was found to be a significant risk locus in the male-only analysis with a noted p-value of 9.55×10^-9, indicating its relevance in BPD, despite not being significant in the main analysis.
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: The SNP rs2585447, known to be a risk allele for MS, was found in the BCAS1 gene which exhibited a splice variant in MS patient samples. This finding suggested that alternative isoforms of BCAS1 might play a role in the pathophysiology of MS and early myelination.
title: Gene expression and alternative splicing analysis in a large-scale Multiple Sclerosis study

finding: The rs6059655 variant in the ASIP gene was found to have a 1.9-fold increase in effect size for BCC risk in SOTRs compared to non-transplantees (SOTR log (OR)=0.49 vs log (OR)=0.26 in non-transplantees). This indicated a significant association of the variant with BCC risk in the transplant population.
title: Re-weighting MC1R, ASIP and IRF4 risk variants optimises polygenic risk scores for keratinocyte cancer stratification in solid organ transplant recipients

finding: The SNP rs750318549, a frameshift mutation in <ASXL1>, was significantly associated with smoking behaviors, particularly with nicotine dependence (OR=2.41; CI=1.9-3.0; P=7.6e-15). This association was noted amongst 371 heterozygous carriers in a cohort, emphasizing the somatic origin of the variant, as carriers were found to be older than non-carriers.
title: Rare coding variants in CHRNB2 reduce the likelihood of smoking

finding: SNP rs6047482 was significantly associated with at least one trait connected to Ewing Sarcoma, underscoring its importance in understanding the genetic contributions to this cancer.
title: Subset scanning for multi-trait analysis using GWAS summary statistics

finding: This SNP showed significant associations with traits from the TraitScan analysis relevant to Ewing Sarcoma, reinforcing its potential role in the pathology of the disease.
title: Subset scanning for multi-trait analysis using GWAS summary statistics

finding: The variant rs3746471 located on the KIAA1755 gene was associated with heart rate and variability, which is connected to autonomic nervous system dysfunction and atrial fibrillation.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: Located in an intron of SLC9A8, this SNP was associated with strong direct effects on AUD, revealing its significance in alcohol consumption genetics.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: SNP rs4811602 was confirmed with significant associations related to cardiovascular traits in the EUR population and a replicated finding in the AFR cohort, affirming it as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs56057703 was acknowledged for its associations with body weight which impacts cardiovascular health; noticed again makes it a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The intergenic SNP rs1015362 was identified as an enhancer and mapped to the androgen receptor binding sequence, which is implicated in tumor growth and carcinogenesis, especially regarding prostate cancer.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The SNP rs3746619 was associated with age at menarche (AAM) in a statistical epistasis with GPR83 expression-increasing alleles. Specifically, function-increasing alleles at this locus conferred increasingly earlier AAM when paired with GPR83 alleles, indicating a significant interaction that enhances the understanding of puberty timing.
title: Understanding the genetic complexity of puberty timing across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs13040917 was associated with prostate cancer (PCa) progression, specifically relating to patient recurrence-free survival and the transition from hormone-sensitive prostate cancer (HSPC) to castration-resistant prostate cancer (CRPC). This finding was noted in the context of identifying novel gene signatures which could potentially serve as predictive markers for rapidly progressing cases of CRPC.
title: Identifying patients with rapid progression from hormone-sensitive to castration-resistant prostate cancer: a retrospective study

finding: The study provided evidence that the rs2209313-T allele, which is associated with the SIRPβ1 duplication, demonstrated a significant correlation with an increased risk of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD) in patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI). Homozygous Dup/Dup patients exhibited a greater cerebrospinal fluid t-Tau/Aβ42 ratio (p-value=0.018) and a higher likelihood of conversion from MCI to AD as confirmed by longitudinal data. Patients demonstrating the Dup/Dup genotype also showed less medial temporal atrophy and fewer white matter hyperintensities, suggesting decreased neural damage, while displaying a slower cognitive decline (p-value=0.043) in comparison to wild-type carriers.
title: An intragenic duplication within SIRPβ1 shows a dual effect over Alzheimer’s disease cognitive decline altering the microglial response

finding: The SNP rs80150989 in the PRPF6 gene showed evidence of colocalisation with lung adenocarcinoma risk, indicating a novel genetic susceptibility locus linking LTL and lung cancer.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: The rs139242164 variant showed a maternal-specific association with thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) levels and confirmed a prior association reported in the Icelandic population related to GNAS gene variations and pseudo-hypoparathyroidism.
title: Genome-wide survey of parent-of-origin specific associations across clinical traits derived from electronic health records

finding: The SNP rs1274412848, causing a cysteine to serine alteration at position 148 of the PCNA protein (p.C148S), was identified as a homozygous transversion mutation within exon five of the PCNA gene. This mutation was confirmed in three patients with PCNA-Associated DNA Repair Disorder (PARD). While the C148S variant maintained a wild-type like structure and affinity towards binding partners, it exhibited a thermo-stability defect, contributing to reduced chromatin-bound PCNA levels in patient-derived cells. This rare allele was absent in healthy family members and was suggested to be pathogenic due to the high conservation of the C148 residue across metazoan species.
title: PCNA thermosensitivity underlies an Ataxia Telangiectasia-like disorder

finding: The variant rs67351073 located at 20q13 in ZGPAT was associated with a decreased risk of OC, presenting an odds ratio of 0.78 (95% CI: 0.72, 0.85, p_meta=4.45×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The SNP rs62202906, part of MACROD2, was associated with retinal thickness. It has been previously suggested as a finding for thyroid-associated orbitopathy.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: Alongside rs62202906, this locus was identified through pixel-level analyses and was associated with retinal thickness, confirming its significance in the current context.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: This SNP was associated with NNAT expression in the retina, which is crucial for brain and nervous system development, indicating its potential role in retinal thickness.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: SNP rs73274724 was another intergenic variant near SNAI1 found to be novel and associated with substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs8126001, located in the 5’ UTR of OPRL1 and upstream from RGS19, was previously associated with levels of triglycerides (TGs), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), systolic blood pressure (SBP), waist circumference, and waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for body mass index (WHRadjBMI). This SNP's significant associations underline its potential relevance in cardiometabolic risk factors.
title: Identification of Genetic Loci Simultaneously Associated with Multiple Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The SNP rs6104690 was significantly associated with bladder cancer risk, as noted in the literature with P-values suggesting a meaningful correlation.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs6108803 showed significant associations with bladder cancer risk, particularly when accounting for overlapping genetic factors in GWAS.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs1342740627 was associated with left ventricular outflow tract obstruction (LVOTO broad) defects. It was located in the intronic region of GGTLC1 with a beta value of 4.8 and P-value of 1.8×10−8. This variant was indicated to be highly enriched in the Finnish population.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic data analyses highlight KPNB1 and MYL4 as novel risk genes for congenital heart disease

finding: The rs2618566 variant, identified in a previous analysis as a liver tissue caQTL, showed evidence of altered chromatin accessibility upon base editing. This supported its role in potentially affecting LDL-C uptake, although specific downstream gene effects were not detailed in this study.
title: Joint genotypic and phenotypic outcome modeling improves base editing variant effect quantification

finding: The rs8126001 variant, located in the OPRL1/RGS19 promoter, was associated with decreased expression of OPRL1 after editing from the minor to the major allele, which corresponded with decreased chromatin accessibility and findings pointing to its role in decreasing LDL-C uptake.
title: Joint genotypic and phenotypic outcome modeling improves base editing variant effect quantification

finding: This intronic variant near PTPRT was rare in all populations tested, excluding Asians. The association with FI highlighted its significance in glucose-related traits.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: An intergenic variant near PTPRT, this rare signal was found to have associations with FI and was common in the African population, indicating its relevance in diverse genetic backgrounds.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The variant rs4810485 colocalized with CD40 levels and was significantly associated with genetic associations for all-stroke, ischemic-stroke, and large-artery-stroke, suggesting a common underlying genetic cause for these associations.
title: Genetically predicted levels of the human plasma proteome and risk of stroke: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The exonic variant rs1800961 was connected to the gene HNF4A and exhibited a very significant p-value of 4.06×10^-16, providing insights into the genetic predisposition to heart failure.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The SNP rs680379 in the SPTLC3 gene was associated with the ratio of SM(d34:1)/SM(d43:1) at genome-wide significance (p-value = 1.01 × 10^-9), indicating its importance in sphingomyelin metabolism linked to Alzheimer's Disease biomarker markers based on mGWAS conducted on ADNI participants.
title: Multi-Omic Analyses Characterize the Ceramide/Sphingomyelin Pathway as a Therapeutic Target in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs168622 was found to replicate a previous association with sphingomyelin metabolite ratios, showing a high correlation (r^2 = 0.98) with SNP rs680379 in a larger population-based mGWAS. This illustrates its significance in the context of metabolic alterations related to Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Multi-Omic Analyses Characterize the Ceramide/Sphingomyelin Pathway as a Therapeutic Target in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The variant rs6011779 was also identified as associated with lung cancer in the latest meta-analysis, supporting its significance in the context of lung cancer susceptibility.
title: Machine learning-based proteogenomic data modeling identifies circulating plasma biomarkers for early detection of lung cancer

finding: Located near the GATA5 gene on chromosome 20, this SNP showed an association with conversion, with a hazard ratio of 2.67 and a p-value of 1.47 x 10^-9.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Prostate Cancer Conversion from Active Surveillance to Treatment

finding: The SNP rs7360523, located on chromosome 20 near the SULF2 gene, was identified as the only locus significantly associated with disease-specific mortality at a genome-wide level (p < 5x10^-8). This association specifically pertained to patients with heart failure, highlighting its relevance to the progression of that disease.
title: Limited overlap between genetic effects on disease susceptibility and disease survival

finding: The rs73106997 SNP associated with the NCOA6 locus had a significant association with Endoglin levels, with a p-value of 1.12 x 10^-10. It was also linked to venous thrombosis in prior studies.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The intergenic SNP rs364585, flanking the SPTLC3 gene, showed a significant association with the lipid species Cer(d19:1/22:0) (P=7.81×10−185). This association added to the understanding of lipid regulation and its potential implications for CAD.
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of the human lipidome identifies novel loci controlling lipid homeostasis with links to coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs6065926 was linked to the cluster of differentiation 40 (CD40) gene, which is important for immune response regulation. This association revealed a microglial enhancer's influence on the gene. The finding established a connection between the common variant and its role in affecting microglia-specific regulation of CD40, addressing prior gaps in knowledge about immune-related dysregulations in schizophrenia.
title: Biological Insights from Schizophrenia-associated Loci in Ancestral Populations

finding: The G allele frequency in rs2070235 (MYBL2) in Amami-Oshima island (0.324) was significantly higher than in the Hondo cluster (0.185, P < 0.001) but not significantly different from the Ryukyu cluster (0.291, P = 0.228). No significant difference in G allele frequency was found in Kikai island in comparison to the other populations (P = 0.324 with Amami-Oshima island, P = 0.456 with Ryukyu cluster, P = 0.167 with Hondo cluster). This SNP was considered in the context of selective pressure influences.
title: Genetic lineage of the Amami islanders inferred from classical genetic markers

finding: The study reported that the SNP rs2275294 in the regulatory region of the ZNF512B gene was associated with survival span in patients with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) according to several meta-studies. Higher expression levels of ZNF512B influenced the formation of protein and DNA aggregates, which might link to the severity of ALS, suggesting that patients with this SNP could experience altered ZNF512B protein levels and ribosome biogenesis, potentially impacting disease outcomes.
title: ZNF512B binds RBBP4 via a variant NuRD interaction motif and aggregates chromatin in a NuRD complex-independent manner

finding: The SNP rs13040707 related to the study published by Frascotti et al. in 2021, which explored the role of vault nanoparticles in drug delivery and therapy. The research highlighted that vaults, recognized as self by the immune system, can be utilized to shield packaged molecules, such as viruses. This finding supports the potential for vaults to be an effective delivery platform for gene therapies, particularly for overcoming the issue of preexisting neutralizing antibodies against adeno-associated virus (AAV) therapies.
title: Encapsulation of AAVs into protein vault nanoparticles as a novel solution to gene therapy’s neutralizing antibody problem

finding: The SNP rs6074022 was associated with CD40 expression in synovial fibroblasts (SFs) under stimulation from proinflammatory cytokines. It exhibited strong eQTL effects, particularly under 8-mix and IFN-γ conditions. This locus was also in tight linkage disequilibrium with another established RA risk locus, rs4810485, suggesting its impact on RA pathogenesis.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs4810485 was linked to the expression of CD40 in SFs, reinforcing its role as a risk factor for RA. Importantly, the eQTL effects associated with this locus were not observed in B cells, underscoring the specific relevance to the inflammatory context in SFs.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs73105013-T in the gene MAP1LC3A was associated with an increased risk for wet age-related macular degeneration (AMD) according to a study on a cohort of Finnish patients. This finding highlighted the role of autophagy-related genetic variations in the susceptibility to AMD, linking metabolic dysfunction and inflammation to the risk of developing retinal diseases.
title: Transcriptomic changes predict metabolic alterations in LC3 associated phagocytosis in aged mice

finding: 'rs6062490' was associated with allele-dependent chromatin accessibility in atopic dermatitis. Specifically, the AD patient was homozygous for the risk allele, resulting in increased expression of genes within its haplotype block, including 'RTEL1' and 'TNFRSF6B', which are linked to T cell function and AD pathology.
title: maxATAC: genome-scale transcription-factor binding prediction from ATAC-seq with deep neural networks

finding: 'rs1151624' was linked to allele-dependent chromatin accessibility as well. The provided context indicated a trend where increasing expression of 'SLC2A4RG' was observed in AD patients carrying the risk variant, highlighting its connection to T cell biology and AD.
title: maxATAC: genome-scale transcription-factor binding prediction from ATAC-seq with deep neural networks

finding: SNP rs1800961, a missense mutation in HNF4A, was strongly associated with liver-related traits such as high-density lipoprotein and total cholesterol levels, underscoring its relevance in liver metabolism.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs6024870 was identified at the CASS4 locus, where it functioned as a regulatory enhancer that contacted the promoter of the adjacent gene RTFDC1. The protective minor A allele of this SNP was associated with decreased expression of RTFDC1 in human microglial cell models (HMC3 and iMg). Functional studies revealed that deletion of the regulatory region containing rs6024870 led to increased secretion of pro-inflammatory cytokines and decreased efficiency in DNA double strand break repair, implicating that this variant influences microglial inflammatory responses and DNA damage resolution.
title: Variant-to-function mapping of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease GWAS signals in human microglial cell models implicates RTFDC1 at the CASS4 locus

finding: The SNP rs6141383 within the BPIFB1 gene also had a discovery P-value around 10-4 and was replicated. In the Mix Bayes analysis, the estimated OR was 1.31 with a posterior interval of (0.73 – 2.36), indicating a significant range of uncertainty but suggesting a possible increase in risk.
title: Quantifying posterior effect size distribution of susceptibility loci by common summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs6062304 was associated with lymphocyte percentage and was confidently assigned to the LIME1 gene through both TWAS and coloc methods. The findings demonstrated that rs6062304 had a high correlation with the predicted expression of LIME1, suggesting its significant role in T cell signaling.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study in UK Biobank Europeans identifies associations with blood cell traits

finding: SNP rs228836 demonstrated genome-wide significance in both the UKB GWAS and the EUR-specific meta-analysis of SHR.
title: Genetics of skeletal proportions in two different populations

finding: This SNP was found to be strongly linked with PROC protein regulation. Its relationship with coronary heart disease variants underlines its clinical significance in cardiovascular and obesity-related research.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs13040855 was associated with the regenerative response of adult tissue-specific stem cells following radiation exposure. It played a significant role in the Hippo/YAP and Notch signaling pathways, which were crucial in mediating the relationship between tissue architecture and cell fate decisions during regeneration. This finding highlighted how genetic variations can influence stem cell dynamics and their ability to differentiate appropriately in response to tissue injury.
title: Conserved signals orchestrate self-organization and symmetry breaking of bi-layered epithelia during development and regeneration

finding: The SNP rs169311 was associated with Adolescent Idiopathic Scoliosis (AIS) and was found to reside within PEC7, an enhancer that was previously demonstrated to have diminished enhancer activity in zebrafish upon introduction of this variant. The findings indicated that rs169311 downregulated PAX1 gene expression in developing somites, suggesting a role in the regulation of spine development that is pertinent to AIS.
title: Deletion of Pax1 scoliosis-associated regulatory elements leads to a female-biased tail abnormality

finding: The SNP rs6059655 in the RALY/ASIP gene was identified as an original finding associated with self-reported aging, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing facial aging processes.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs1205312, another variant in the RALY/ASIP gene, was highlighted as a significant finding related to self-reported facial aging, indicating its role in the aging phenotype.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs6088372 within the RALY/ASIP gene was found to be associated with self-reported aging, providing additional insights into genetic contributions to facial aging.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The variant rs2424995 in the PIGU gene was associated with self-reported facial aging, contributing to the broader understanding of the genetic landscape of facial aging.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs151176846, located on chr20q13 within the CHRNA4 gene, was noted for its significant association with nicotine dependence (ND). This SNP, along with others identified, supported the genetic basis of smoking behaviors.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: The rs14316 locus was significantly associated with beat synchronization and is located within a human-accelerated region (HAR). It was found to be an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) regulating GBE1 expression across various tissues, linking it to traits like neuromuscular diseases and reaction time.
title: Genome-wide association study of musical beat synchronization demonstrates high polygenicity

finding: The SNP rs13040745 was assessed in the context of TP53's functional status. It was identified as a positive and original finding related to tumors with non-mutational p53 inactivations, categorized as TP53WT-pRF. This categorization indicated that these genetically normal tumors exhibited compromised p53 function, sharing significant genomic characteristics with p53 mutant tumors, including increased tumor mutation burden and copy number variation. Importantly, patients carrying tumors with this SNP experienced shorter overall survival and disease-free survival, alongside heightened sensitivity to platinum-based chemotherapy and radiation therapy.
title: Identify non-mutational p53 functional deficiency in human cancers

finding: The GSS SNP rs6087652 was linked to osmotic fragility and was significant in the context of lipid peroxidation pathways and their influence on RBC longevity.
title: Ferroptosis regulates hemolysis in stored murine and human red blood cells

finding: In the analysis, the SNP rs6026398 was reported as the most significant with a beta of -0.6496 and a p-value of 0.000814, associating with changes in brain segregation as assessed through Louvain modularity. This finding indicated its potential role in the progression of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Brain Connectivity Changes for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The single nucleotide polymorphism rs1047383 in the PLCB1 gene was associated with drug dependence and specifically identified in a subgroup of cocaine addicted patients. This association was replicated in an independent clinical sample, and additional genetic variants in PLCB1 were found to be nominally associated with both illegal substance and cocaine addiction in two genome-wide association studies (GWAS) conducted on European-American samples. This finding highlighted PLCB1's relevance to cocaine addiction.
title: Reduced cue-induced reinstatement of cocaine seeking behavior in Plcb1+/- mice

finding: The SNP rs867186 was found to have a strong causal association with deep venous thrombosis (DVT), exhibiting a significant p-value and high colocalization probability with protein C levels, driven by a trans pQTL analysis.
title: Phenome-wide Mendelian randomization mapping the influence of the plasma proteome on complex diseases

finding: The rs8126001 variant was found in the 5' UTR of the OPRL1 gene and had a protective allele associated with sPTB (effect: 0.896; adjusted p-value 4.04×10−5). It showed signatures of positive selection and impacted expression of OPRL1 across multiple tissues.
title: Accounting for diverse evolutionary forces reveals the mosaic nature of selection on genomic regions associated with human preterm birth

finding: The SNP rs1130146 was identified as a missense variant in the DDX27 gene on chromosome 20. This SNP had a CADD score of 31 and was predicted to be deleterious by SIFT and possibly damaging by PolyPhen, making it a positive finding associated with longevity.
title: Identification of 13 independent genetic loci associated with cognitive resilience in healthy aging in 330,097 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The study provided evidence that the SNP rs6042259 was associated with the role of CTCF binding at the BARTp CTCF BS, which regulates EBV gene expression and contributes to the pathogenesis of EBV-associated gastric carcinoma (EBVaGC). The findings emphasized that mutations in the BARTp CTCF BS affected infectivity and the expression of key viral genes like EBNA1, LMP1, and BZLF1, thus indicating a significant linkage between this SNP and the viral genetics involved in EBVaGC.
title: CTCF-mediated Genomic Effects of BART Region on Epstein-Barr Virus Chromatin 3D Structure in Gastric Carcinoma Cells

finding: The SNP rs5029909 located in the FOXA2 gene was identified as a novel locus associated with HOMA-B, displaying a significant association with P=2.70×10^-8 and indicating its role in β-cell function related to type 2 diabetes.
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The SNP rs6113722 was noted as an established locus overlapping with the novel HOMA-B associated variant at rs5029909, showcasing its strong correlation with fasting glucose in the European population (R^2=0.69).
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The lead variant rs115838297, found in the intron of the DOK5 gene on chromosome 20, demonstrated a significant association with waist circumference and waist-to-hip ratio. This variant also showed low frequency (~4%) in African ancestry populations, suggesting its relevance to body composition traits uniquely within these populations as opposed to broader studies like the UKBiobank.
title: Whole-genome Studies of Malagasy People Uncover Novel Body Composition Associations

finding: The rs143384 SNP showed a significant association with chronic knee pain, marking it as a validated genomic locus for this phenotype.
title: Analysis of genetically independent phenotypes identifies shared genetic factors associated with chronic musculoskeletal pain at different anatomic sites

finding: The SNP rs2185591 related to PTPRT was recognized for its involvement in cellular signaling connected to AML mutational networks.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: SNP rs285206, related to MYBL2, was recognized for its role in cell cycle and prognosis in AML, highlighting its clinical significance.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The study highlighted the role of the <italic>Wee1</italic> gene in regulating the cell cycle during diapause in avian embryos. The SNP rs13040795 was associated with this gene, whereby upregulation of <italic>Wee1</italic> at low temperatures (12°C) led to cell cycle arrest at the G2/M phase. This established a critical mechanism for preserving embryonic cytoarchitecture, thus enabling successful resumption of development (SRD) after diapause. Conversely, at higher temperatures, decreased expression of <italic>Wee1</italic> corresponded with continued cell proliferation and maladaptive morphology, suggesting implications for survivability.
title: HREM, RNAseq and cell-cycle analyses reveal the role of the G2/M-regulatory protein, Wee1, on the survivability of chicken embryos during diapause

finding: The SNP rs6042049 was identified in a study examining the regulation of the MYB transcription factor in relation to differentiation, the cell cycle, and oncogenesis. The connection to oncogenic pathways highlighted its significance in cancer biology, supporting the potential of MYB as a therapeutic target.
title: Rapid-kinetics degron benchmarking reveals off-target activities and mixed agonism-antagonism of MYB inhibitors

finding: SNP rs4468878 showed differential binding of SFRS9 to mutated lncRNA due to changes in the binding motif caused by the mutation.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins
