finding: rs6065904 had positive associations with small high-density lipoprotein (S-HDL-P) and medium high-density lipoprotein (M-HDL-P), but negative associations with L-HDL-P, XL-HDL-P, HDL-D, ApoA1, HDL-C, and coronary artery disease (CAD). This indicated a complex role in HDL metabolism and CAD risk.
title: A Mendelian randomization study of the role of lipoprotein subfractions in coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP was in strong LD as it was previously identified with coronary heart disease, underscoring its importance in metabolic and cardiovascular health.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The intronic SNP rs11087622 in the SMOX gene was associated with spermine levels, indicating its role in the genetic regulation of this metabolite alongside its linkage to the synonymous mutation A392A.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs13040698 was associated with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) in the context of tumorigenicity and chemoresistance. Specifically, it was found that inhibition of mitochondrial dynamics, related to the genetic variations at this locus, preferentially targeted PDAC cells that exhibited enhanced tumorigenic and invasive potential. The research emphasized the connection between this SNP and the aggressive characteristics of PaCSCs, suggesting that it may influence the biology of PDAC and its response to therapies.
title: ALK signaling drives tumorigenicity and chemoresistance of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cells

finding: The SNP rs6031705 was associated with the human papillomavirus (HPV) variants in the context of cancer, specifically related to its role in influencing carcinogenic capabilities of the E6 oncoproteins. Findings indicated that this SNP could play a role in how the HPV E6 protein interacts with host cellular proteins, thereby potentially contributing to the differential promotion of carcinogenesis observed between the European Prototype and Asian-American variants. The study highlighted this SNP's involvement in transforming E6 functionality, which is crucial in HPV-related cancers.
title: Virus-host protein-protein interactions between human papillomavirus 16 E6 A1 and D2/D3 sub-lineages: variances and similarities

finding: The findings showed that the SNP rs185545661, which encoded a proline-to-threonine change at amino acid position 306 in the SPO11 protein, impacted fertility in mice. Male and female mice carrying this allele exhibited reduced sperm and oocyte counts, synapsis defects, and fewer Type 1 crossovers, suggesting a likely association with infertility and potential risks of aneuploid gametes if similar effects were observed in humans.
title: A segregating human allele of SPO11 modeled in mice disrupts timing and amounts of meiotic recombination, causing oligospermia and a decreased ovarian reserve

finding: The SNP rs13040645 was significantly associated with breast cancer progression, as demonstrated in the work by Rigiracciolo et al. in 2021. They discussed how this SNP influences multifaceted signaling pathways involving focal adhesion kinase, related to breast cancer aggressiveness.
title: FAK family proteins regulate in vivo breast cancer metastasis via distinct mechanisms

finding: The rs867186-GG genotype was associated with increased soluble EPCR levels, which suggested a potential mediating role in providing protection against severe malaria. This finding related directly to the pathogenesis of malaria-associated acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) as increased EPCR concentrations were noted to enhance infected red blood cell (iRBC) cytoadherence, thus contributing to ARDS severity.
title: Endothelial Protein C Receptor Contributes to Experimental Malaria-Associated Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome

finding: SNP rs6088607 correlated with greater SA of the temporal pole for BD, emphasizing its role in brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs2143943 was linked with elevated temporal pole SA for BD, reflecting its influence on cortical morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Presence of the risk allele at rs6087990 was linked with reduced NFKB1 target gene expression in non-inflamed patients, but raised expression in patients with the risk allele in specific clusters during inflammation. Therefore, it showed differential impact based on the inflammatory state in UC.
title: A systems genomics approach to uncover patient-specific pathogenic pathways and proteins in a complex disease

finding: The SNP rs6078373 was identified in relation to smoking behavior in the EAS population. It was found to be intergenic and strongly correlated with a combination of two SNPs in the BTBD3 gene, indicating a potential synthetic association.
title: On the contribution of genetic heterogeneity to complex traits

finding: The SNP rs235710 in the 5' region of BMP2 was found to be significant with a p-value of 0.029. This finding related to mandible volume in a study involving children with and without prenatal alcohol exposure.
title: Mutation in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and human to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: The SNP rs143383 was associated with OA through its regulation of CpG methylation, which modulated the binding of SP1 and SP3 repressor proteins affecting the expression of GDF5. This finding related to the susceptibility of individuals to osteoarthritis, reinforcing the importance of epigenetic factors in OA pathogenesis.
title: An evolutionary perspective of DNA methylation patterns in skeletal tissues using a nonhuman primate model of osteoarthritis

finding: This SNP was recognized as a caQTL for a classical monocyte-specific site (π=0.43, q-value=0.0018) while being active across all immune cell types.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The SNP rs13040795 was associated with the response to the combined inhibition of PP2A and WEE1 in colon cancer models, as highlighted in the study by Gorecki et al. (2021). This finding emphasized its relevance to tumor growth suppression in patient-derived tumors in vivo, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus could influence the efficacy of targeting the atr-chk1-wee1 axis in cancer therapy.
title: Paradoxical activation of oncogenic signaling as a cancer treatment strategy

finding: The SNP rs4911178 was found to modify hip and knee morphology in humans, predisposing individuals to joint disease, and similarly affected joint morphology in single base pair replacement mice.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: SNP rs6060369 resided within a conserved hind limb enhancer element in the GDF5 cis-regulatory locus. It was associated with significantly decreased GDF5 expression in vivo and decreased tibial length in mice, indicating its potential role in height variation.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: SNP rs6060539 was also found to be significantly associated with body size across mammals and in CC mice, indicating a role in height regulation.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: The SNP rs680379 in the SPTLC3 gene was substantially associated with a wide range of ceramide species. It showed a P-value of 4.82x10^-27, and its AA genotype was linked to a 48% increase in the concentration of CER[N(24)S(19)] compared to the GG genotype, indicating a strong influence on ceramide biosynthesis.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: SNP rs438568, located in the SPTLC3 gene, was associated with the ceramide trait CER[N(22)S(19)], further supporting the implication of this locus in ceramide biomarker variations with GWAS significance.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: The SNP rs62208470 was associated with chromatin accessibility at the ZHX3 locus, coinciding with increased accessibility in both mouse oligodendrocyte lineage cells (OLG) and microglia (MiGl) during experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE). This suggests its role in the regulatory mechanisms involved in MS susceptibility and was confirmed by overlap with chromatin accessibility in human OPCs in non-disease contexts.
title: A primed immune transcriptional program is activated in oligodendroglia in multiple sclerosis

finding: SNP rs6065254 showed significant opposite associations with luminal A-like (OR=0.96) and triple-negative (OR=1.04) breast cancer subtypes, indicating its relevance in stratifying risk according to tumor characteristics.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: The SNP rs747759, found to be the tag SNP for the trait 'Neuroticism', exhibited higher expression of the nearby gene CD40 in humans compared to macaques. This SNP was identified as having potential impacts on enhancer activity related to binding sites for transcription factors NFYA and NHLH1, thus linking it to neurological development.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: SNP rs1535043 was linked to CD40 expression as well, showing higher expression in humans. This SNP's human allele T was associated with the gain of an EHF binding site, adding complexity to its role in central nervous system traits, although the exact implications were still unclear.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: The SNP rs13040896 was linked to the activation of the nuclear receptor LRH-1/NR5A2, which played a crucial role in reversing hyperglycemia in mouse models of type 1 diabetes mellitus (T1DM). The contextual relevance of this finding was emphasized by the induction of a shift in immune cell phenotype from pro-inflammatory to anti-inflammatory/tolerogenic states. These alterations not only improved islet function and survival but also contributed to the expansion of regulatory T-cells, which consequently impeded cytotoxic T-cell proliferation, demonstrating a potential therapeutic approach for managing T1DM.
title: LRH-1/NR5A2 Activation in Immune Cells from Individuals with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus Mitigates Inflammation via Immunometabolic Reprogramming and Enhanced Human Islet Function in Mice

finding: The SNP rs143383 was originally identified in the context of osteoarthritis and was found to regulate allelic expression of the GDF5 gene. This regulation occurs via modulation of binding of SP1 and SP3 repressor proteins, linking the SNP to disease susceptibility. The findings highlighted the importance of DNA methylation changes and their association with key cartilage gene loci during chondrogenesis, implicating this specific SNP in the epigenetic landscape relevant to cartilage health and disease.
title: DNA hypomethylation during MSC chondrogenesis occurs predominantly at enhancer regions

finding: The causal variant rs6064392 in the CASS4 locus demonstrated significance in MPRA (p = 1.04 × 10−22) and CRISPR in microglia (p = 4.2 × 10−2), establishing it as a validated variant associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Beyond guilty by association at scale: searching for causal variants on the basis of genome-wide summary statistics

finding: This SNP was located in the intron of the CD40 gene and was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), Crohn's disease (CD), and ulcerative colitis (UC). The CD40 intronic peak was linked to key immune function genes in the eGRN and previous studies had identified this SNP as an expression, protein, and splice quantitative trait locus (e-, p-, sQTL) in blood and monocyte-specific datasets. CD40, being expressed in antigen presenting cells including macrophages, plays a critical role in T-cell activation, implicating its significance in the pathogenesis of autoimmune diseases.
title: Scalable ultra-high-throughput single-cell chromatin and RNA sequencing reveals gene regulatory dynamics linking macrophage polarization to autoimmune disease

finding: In the context of global-scale land cover mapping and its effects on ecosystem functions, particularly pollination efficiency, the rs3092057 SNP was identified as an original finding. The study indicated that uncertainty in land cover maps could influence ecological assessments, revealing a direct correlation with how accurately ecosystem functions, like pollination, could be mapped.
title: A guide to between-community functional dissimilarity measures

finding: The SNP rs143383 was identified as an osteoarthritis susceptibility SNP that is regulated by CpG methylation. This regulation involves the modulation of binding of SP1 and SP3 repressor proteins, which is signified by its association with complex skeletal traits, particularly in the context of morphological variants linked to skeletal health.
title: Intra- and Inter-Specific Investigations of Skeletal DNA Methylation and Femur Morphology in Primates

finding: The minor allele of SNP rs13045408 at BTBD3-LINC01722 positively correlated with Bacteroides abundance (β = 0.043; P = 5.3 × 10−3) and negatively correlated with Prevotella abundance (β = -1.76; P = 1.6 × 10−4). This association was part of the study focusing on the enterotype concept involving Prevotella and Bacteroides.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: This SNP was associated with MUC5B concentrations specifically in non-current smokers. Its role in gene interactions involving smoking effects makes it notable in the study of COPD-related mucus production.
title: Genetic Regulators of Sputum Mucin Concentration and Their Associations with COPD Phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12481710 showed a positive correlation between proximal tubule cell fractions and SYCP2 expression in the kidneys of subjects with higher allele dosage of G. This indicated a specific genotype-gene expression interaction within the proximal tubule cell type.
title: Mapping the genetic architecture of human traits to cell types in the kidney identifies mechanisms of disease and potential treatments

finding: The SNP rs2144782 on chromosome 20 showed a strong probability of association with ADHD, ASD, and OCD, achieving a p-value of 4.18 x 10^-10. Its m-values indicated a high probability for association across these disorders, specifically m_ADHD = 1, m_ASD = 1, and m_OCD = 0.911. This SNP was located within the KIZ/KIZ-AS1 gene.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: SNP rs12625304 was associated with ADHD, ASD, and OCD with a p-value of 8.12 x 10^-9. It exhibited m-values greater than 0.9 in at least three disorders (m_ADHD = 0.986, m_ASD = 1, m_OCD = 0.918), indicating a potentially high cross-disorder effect.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs57080033 was significantly associated with ADHD, ASD, and OCD, presenting a p-value of 2.90 x 10^-8. Its m-values demonstrated a strong association across these disorders (m_ADHD = 0.999, m_ASD = 1, m_OCD = 0.83), supporting the hypothesis of shared genetic risk.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: SNP rs6047287 was identified as significant in the context of the ASD GWAS and was also highlighted in the ADHD-ASD-OCD-TS GWAS meta-analysis with a previously noted p-value of 2.72 x 10^-10, suggesting its relevance across multiple psychiatric disorders.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: SNP rs1000177 was associated with ASD and TS with a significant p-value of 1.79 x 10^-9 and m-value of 1 for ASD, indicating notable genetic overlap between these two disorders.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs13040731 was associated with melanoma, specifically in the context of disruptions in PBAF complex assembly due to ARID2 mutations. This mutation was linked to altered chromatin accessibility which allowed upregulation of synaptic transcripts, indicating its importance in cancer progression.
title: The SWI/SNF PBAF complex facilitates REST occupancy at repressive chromatin

finding: The SNP rs13040909 was linked to the activities of enzymes PFKFB3 and PFKFB4, which are implicated in cancer metabolism. The research indicated that variations at this locus could influence disease development and progression, suggesting a genetic basis for therapeutic targeting in cancer. These findings provided insights into metabolic reprogramming's role in cellular signaling and tonotopic morphologies within auditory mechanosensory hair cells.
title: Gradients in cellular metabolism regulate development of tonotopy along the cochlea

finding: The SNP rs200294064 was identified as a pathogenic candidate driver mutation in the TGM3 gene. This finding was contextualized within the study of carcinomas of the head and neck, indicating the role of TGM3 as a candidate driver gene in nasopharyngeal carcinoma.
title: Ontology-based prediction of cancer driver genes

finding: The SNP rs13040801 was linked to AKT3 expression in mesenchymal colorectal cancer cells, indicating that it drives growth and is associated with epithelial-mesenchymal transition. This finding was relevant in the context of tumorigenesis and could have implications in understanding metastatic behavior in pancreatic cancer as well.
title: Down-regulation of AKT proteins slows the growth of mutant-KRAS pancreatic tumors

finding: The MMP-9 rs17576 polymorphism was highlighted as being associated with susceptibility to type 2 diabetes, indicating its relevance in metabolic health.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs2425019 was reported to be associated with height and is located 4.5kb downstream of variable CAG or GGC repeats in the MMP24 gene. These repeats encode poly-leucine, poly-alanine, and poly-proline tracts, indicating that variations in this region may influence protein function related to height.
title: Genome-wide survey of tandem repeats by nanopore sequencing shows that disease-associated repeats are more polymorphic in the general population

finding: The SNP rs6031431 was identified in enhancer regions associated with the JPH2 gene in rapamycin-treated human coronary artery smooth muscle cells (CASMC). Enhancers linked to this SNP exhibited significant activity, indicating that it may play a role in cardiovascular-associated traits.
title: Epigenetic Remodeling in Human Coronary Artery Smooth Muscle Cell Phenotypic Switching

finding: The SNP rs6031769 was associated with the modulation of drug resistance in cancer. The research context indicated that it may play a role in breast cancer progression and response to treatments, aligning with the observed effects of Chlorpyrifos, which promoted stemness and Epithelial-Mesenchymal Transition in triple negative breast cancer.
title: Chlorpyrifos induces lung metastases and modulation of cancer stem cell markers in triple negative breast cancer model

finding: The SNP rs13040676 was associated with the gene AP4 (tfap4), showing reduced expression in the flapped snout of cichlid species. This gene is linked to the development of craniofacial soft tissues, and the findings implied that this particular SNP plays a role in the conserved genetic pathways involved in mid-line facial development across different species, including those associated with human mid-line dysmorphologies.
title: Parallel molecular mechanisms underlie convergent evolution of the exaggerated snout phenotype in East African cichlids

finding: The analysis indicated a significant enrichment for individuals with one <italic>MC1R</italic> variant and the <italic>ASIP</italic> eQTL risk allele. Among the red-haired individuals possessing one <italic>MC1R</italic> variant, 55% carried the <italic>ASIP</italic> risk allele, compared to 31% of the total red-haired individuals. This difference was statistically significant (Fisher exact test p-value=6.6×10−11), suggesting the importance of the <italic>ASIP</italic> gene in red hair pigmentation.
title: Expanded Analysis of Pigmentation Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The editing study utilized HD patient cells containing the rs363009 SNV. The efficiency of editing was assessed using the AiEvo2 enzyme and showed a significant impact in terms of allele-specific editing, indicating the potential for tailored therapies in Huntington's based on SNP targeting.
title: Discovery and engineering of AiEvo2, a novel Cas12a nuclease for human gene editing applications

finding: This SNP was linked to gamma glutamyltransferase, illustrating a connection to metabolic syndromes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was linked to colorectal cancer via GWAS peak SNP and displayed significant ASM features in T cells.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs1028396 was linked to the response of SIRPA to SARS-CoV-2 in CD14+ monocytes, with indication of a significant selection event preceding the last 45,000 years. This variant showed a considerably lower prevalence in populations other than East Asians, emphasizing its role in adaptive immune responses.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The SNP rs13040823 was implicated in adaptive therapy for metastatic melanoma, as described in the work by Kim et al. (2021). The research utilized patient-calibrated mathematical models to predict responses to treatment.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs13040885 was identified in the study by Gruener et al., which aimed to facilitate drug discovery in breast cancer. The research demonstrated a link between this SNP and drug sensitivity profiles derived from histological images. Specifically, it contributed to the prediction of patient responses to various cancer therapies, thereby suggesting a role in personalizing treatment based on genetic factors and drug efficacy.
title: Cancer drug sensitivity prediction from routine histology images

finding: The rs6062129 variant was found within the MTG2 gene and was associated with changes in time trial measures. It was among variants that showed a moderate correlation with rs6121949, indicating potential involvement in exercise response.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: This variant, also within the MTG2 gene, was linked to time trial performance and showed moderate correlation with rs6062129. Its involvement suggested potential dysregulation impacting mitochondrial function and exercise response.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The SNP rs3918242 was also associated in the Geisinger dataset with a beta of 0.07 (p = 2.65 x 10^-2), suggesting its relevance in OSA.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: This SNP was associated with adenoma count and thus contributed positively to the findings related to colorectal cancer risk.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was included in the PRS analyses and was positively associated with increasing adenoma counts, reinforcing its relevance in colorectal cancer risk evaluation.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2273535 encodes an F31I substitution in aurora kinase A, which showed a higher allele frequency in East Asian populations (67%) and was positively correlated with an increased risk of developing colon cancer among these individuals.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs143383 was implicated in the susceptibility to osteoarthritis (OA) through studies showing that CpG methylation regulates the allelic expression of GDF5. This regulation occurred via modulation of binding by SP1 and SP3 repressor proteins, showcasing a genetic variant's role in OA pathogenesis.
title: Engineered cartilage from human chondrocytes with homozygous knockout of cell cycle inhibitor p21

finding: The study identified that the common variant rs1884302, with a minor allele frequency of 0.33 in European populations and located close to the BMP2 gene, was associated with craniosynostosis. This variant accounted for almost all phenotypic variation observed in the cases studied. Specifically, among the 13 carriers of damaging SMAD6 mutations, 11 were also carriers of rs1884302, while none of the healthy carriers of SMAD6 had this variant. The statistical analysis revealed a highly significant association (p = 1.58×10^-6, OR = 30.95) between the combination of SMAD6 mutations and rs1884302, confirming its role in the digenic inheritance of non-syndromic midline craniosynostosis.
title: A genome-wide case-only test for the detection of digenic inheritance in human exomes

finding: The SNP rs13040883 was positively associated with the regulation of cell growth and proliferation, particularly in the context of the Tribbles pseudokinase as highlighted in the study by Dobens et al. (2021). This study revealed the role of this SNP in various cellular processes, emphasizing its relevance to both wound response mechanisms and tumor stratification in neoplastic growth.
title: Shared enhancer gene regulatory networks between wound and oncogenic programs

finding: The SNP rs12625281 was associated with the gene VSX1 and had a replicated p-value of 3.3e-11 in the largest BMI meta-GWAS to date, indicating its relevance in obesity.
title: Quantitative Genetic Scoring, or how to put a number on an arbitrary genetic region

finding: The SNP rs6138482 was associated with VSX1 and had a significant result in the largest BMI meta GWAS, showing a p-value of 5.8e-13.
title: Quantitative Genetic Scoring, or how to put a number on an arbitrary genetic region

finding: The SNP rs115662534 (T allele) emerged as a potential marker disrupting the binding of transcription factors STAT1 and EBF1 to regulatory elements of the CD40 gene, which could have implications in autoimmune disease mechanisms.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs548231435 (C allele) also acted as a potential marker that disrupted the binding of transcription factors STAT1 and EBF1 to regulatory elements of the CD40 gene, suggesting its significance in the understanding of autoimmune diseases.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: rs2284379 was identified as showing allelic imbalance associated with total insulin content. The C allele was linked to lower insulin levels in certain lines, indicating its potential as a candidate causal SNP.
title: Functional interrogation of twenty type 2 diabetes-associated genes using isogenic hESC-derived β-like cells

finding: rs1800900 was associated with T2D risk in relation to allelic imbalance affecting cellular traits, particularly insulin content.
title: Functional interrogation of twenty type 2 diabetes-associated genes using isogenic hESC-derived β-like cells

finding: The SNP rs13040843 was associated with an important finding related to the mitochondrial protease LONP1 and its role in multiple myeloma, which suggests its relevance in cancer biology. The reference to LONP1 in the context of its interaction with FBXO11 indicates a potential mechanism whereby genetic variations could influence the regulation of mitochondrial functions, thus impacting tumorigenesis. As such, this SNP was tied to the cellular processes that promote myeloid-biased stem cell properties in acute myeloid leukemia.
title: Loss of FBXO11 function establishes a stem cell program in acute myeloid leukemia through dysregulation of mitochondrial LONP1

finding: The SNP rs2031717 was identified as a key genetic locus associated with the metabolism of 5-FU, which is a chemotherapy drug. In the context of the study, it was linked to the observed alterations in the tissue distribution of both Sch-B and 5-FU metabolites in tumor-bearing mice, suggesting a role in modulating drug response and multidrug resistance. This finding contributed to the understanding of how genetic variations can impact drug efficacy and metabolic pathways in colorectal cancer management.
title: Bioavailability of Schisandrin B and its effect on 5-Fluorouracil metabolism in a xenograft mouse model of colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs13040692 was linked to molecular and functional processes that connect neurodevelopmental pathways and treatment-induced neuroendocrine plasticity in prostate cancer progression. This finding underscored the role of genetic variations in influencing the treatment response and transition to NEPC.
title: Targeting Endoplasmic Reticulum Stress and Nitroso-Redox Imbalance in Neuroendocrine Prostate Cancer: The Therapeutic Role of Nitric Oxide

finding: The SNP rs115855396 was identified as a suggestive variant (p = 6.19 x 10^-6) upstream of the NFIA gene in the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute Family Heart Study, linking it to diabetes in individuals on medication for diabetes or glucose.
title: NFIA regulates granule recruitment and exocytosis in the adult pancreas

finding: This intronic variant in BMP7 was associated with microalbuminuria at study-wide significance, with an odds ratio of 6.75, marking its relevance in diabetic kidney disease processes.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The SNP rs6073958 was associated with significantly lower levels of the percentage of free cholesterol in small HDL (S_HDL_FC_pct) in the control group (beta = -0.146, p < 1e-300), but showed no association in the T2D patients' group (beta = -0.002, p = 0.93). This finding related to the interaction of T2D status with genetic regulation of metabolite levels, indicating that the regulatory effect of this SNP was attenuated in T2D cases compared to controls.
title: Insights into the metabolic consequences of type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6021275 was associated with a significant impact on the analysis of burned areas due to its relevance in satellite remote sensing products. The study highlighted the effectiveness of MODIS satellite data, for which this SNP was a marker, in validating burned area assessments within the Niassa Reserve.
title: Spatio-temporal patterns of wildfires in the Niassa Reserve –Mozambique, using remote sensing data

finding: The rs2259735 SNP was used as the cortex-eQTL instrument variable and was linked to higher expression of CYP24A1, indicating an association with increased risk of multiple sclerosis.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The rs2248137 SNP was associated with the expression of CYP24A1, with increasing expression correlating with increasing neuronal proportions for the MS risk allele.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs6086929 was identified as having a significant association with plant phenology changes over the period from 1981 to 2012, as described in the study by Pinzon and Tucker. This study utilized NDVI data to demonstrate how specific genetic variations, including rs6086929, impacted the timing of plant growth cycles in relation to climate conditions.
title: The Portal Project: a long-term study of a Chihuahuan desert ecosystem

finding: The SNP rs17855611, located in the gene SIRPA, demonstrated a strong signal associated with blood protein levels. This finding was particularly significant in the East Asian population, indicating that selection pressures may be related to variations in blood protein traits.
title: Improved detection of evolutionary selection highlights potential bias from different sequencing strategies in complex genomic-regions

finding: SIA detected moderate selection at the ASIP locus, indicated by a selection probability of 0.78 and a selection coefficient of approximately 0.0019, also related to pigmentation.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: SNP rs6013892, located in the enhancer region of CYP24A1, was part of a haplotype strongly affecting transcriptional activity and was linked to vitamin D levels.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: This SNP, associated with vitamin D levels, was shown to significantly alter the regulatory activity of enhancer regions when included in reporter assays.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: The SNP rs143383 was associated with osteoarthritis (OA) due to its role in CpG methylation that regulated the allelic expression of GDF5. This regulation occurred through the modulation of repressor protein binding, specifically SP1 and SP3, highlighting its significance as a susceptibility locus for OA.
title: Modelling Osteoarthritis pathogenesis through Mechanical Loading in an Osteochondral Unit-on-Chip

finding: The enhancer associated with rs6117669, located at +421BMP2, showed broad expression in cranial cartilage and associated structures in transgenic zebrafish. This finding was linked to the risk of craniosynostosis, supporting its functional implication in the disease.
title: Identification of conserved skeletal enhancers associated with craniosynostosis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs11699612 was found within the CASC20 locus and associated with HO susceptibility. It achieved an odds ratio of 1.73 and a p-value of 9.39×10^-8 in the initial analysis, and subsequently replicated with a p-value of 2.70×10^-5 and an OR of 1.90, culminating in a genome-wide significance (p=2.71×10^-11) through meta-analysis, confirming its impact on HO.
title: Genome-wide association and functional analyses identify CASC20 and KIF26B as target loci in heterotopic ossification

finding: This SNP was previously identified as a genetic variant associated with increased risk of ICU admission and mortality from COVID-19. In this study, while it was not associated with progression status, its 3'UTR location suggests it could influence regulatory mechanisms like mRNA localization and stability, particularly related to the THBD gene.
title: Multi-omic Profiling Reveals Early Immunological Indicators for Identifying COVID-19 Progressors

finding: The SNP rs6119471 in the gene ASIP exhibited a significant selection difference between Eurasians and Africans, with the derived allele being nearly fixed in Eurasians while maintaining a low frequency in Africans. This finding was related to pigmentation phenotypes and indicated varying selective pressures among populations.
title: Dissecting dynamics and differences of selective pressures in the evolution of human pigmentation

finding: The gene CHGB variant rs742710 was discussed in the context of early-onset amyotrophic lateral sclerosis and potentially linked to the severity observed in CMS patients, marking it as significant in the study.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: This variant interacted significantly with rs1805009 and was replicated in the study investigating skin color, contributing to epistatic evidence in the trait analysis.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: Associated with skin color, this SNP interacted with rs1805007 showcasing the method's capability to uncover complex genetic interactions related to phenotypic traits.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: The variant rs6059655 was also highlighted as associated with both vitiligo and melanoma, reinforcing the connection between autoimmune conditions and melanoma risk.
title: Autoimmune Alleles at the Major Histocompatibility Locus Modify Melanoma Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs13040892 was associated with aggressive variants of papillary thyroid carcinomas in a study highlighted in the publication. This finding was reported in the context of genetic profiles relevant to the aggressive behavior of thyroid cancers, suggesting a potential link between this SNP and the severity of thyroid cancer manifestations.
title: Tenascin-C potentiates Wnt signaling in thyroid cancer

finding: The study confirmed that the E200K mutation, represented by rs28933385 (c.598G>A, p.Glu200Lys), was a critical finding linked to the most common subtype of genetic prion disease. This variant was directly associated with the disease phenotype observed in the multi-generational Israeli family.
title: NMDA receptor misalignment in iPSC-derived neurons from a multi-generational family with inherited Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease

finding: The SNP rs1799990 (c.385A>G, p.Met129Val) was also confirmed as a relevant finding via whole-exome sequencing. It is noteworthy in the context of prion disease, especially regarding the complex interplay of genetic variations influencing the disease risk and phenotype.
title: NMDA receptor misalignment in iPSC-derived neurons from a multi-generational family with inherited Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease

finding: The SNP rs138688873 was validated as a pertinent genetic variant during the analysis of the whole exome data, contributing to the understanding of the genetic landscape associated with prion diseases.
title: NMDA receptor misalignment in iPSC-derived neurons from a multi-generational family with inherited Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease

finding: The variant rs6064377 was associated with the latent factor ML6, influencing haemoglobin concentration and hematocrit via red blood cell count, with a p-value of 4.6×10^-8.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The SNP rs4810479 was identified as a nominally significant variant with a p-value of 4.8e-4 in the context of triglyceride (TG) levels and current smoking interactions. This SNP is located 4kb upstream of the PLTP gene, which encodes a phospholipid transfer protein. Several studies indicated that smoking influenced the expression of the PLTP gene, specifically noting an increased activity of PLTP in smokers, establishing the relevance of this SNP in the gene-by-exposure interaction.
title: Genome-wide Interaction Studies by the CHARGE Gene-Lifestyle Interactions Working Group: what we’ve learned and what’s coming next

finding: The SNP rs6042155 was identified as a significant variant associated with viral-induced DNA damage and the process of virus integration into host genomic DNA. This finding was presented in the study by Chen et al. (2014), which discussed the role of various factors leading to viral carcinogenesis, highlighting the implications of such integrations on cancer development and genetic integrity.
title: Computational methods for the discovery and annotation of viral integrations

finding: The SNP rs6065717 was positively identified in a publication by Mueller et al. (2014) that discussed the impact of human land-use practices on global long-term increases in photosynthetic capacity. This finding highlighted a significant connection between genetic variations and environmental factors, specifically within the context of biodiversity and ecological resilience, showcasing how genetic markers can correlate with ecological measurements.
title: Predictability and transferability of local biodiversity environment relationships

finding: The Q93E substitution was associated with its ability to create an additional cleavage site for the viral proteinase 3Cpro. This cleavage could hinder MAVS's function in signal transmission, likely contributing to increased CVB3 infectivity.
title: Modeling the complete kinetics of coxsackievirus B3 reveals human determinants of host-cell feedback

finding: The SNP rs13040676 was linked to the activity of the transcription factor AP4, which was shown to mediate cell fate decisions such as division, aging, or apoptosis. This finding was significant in understanding the role of transcriptional regulation in cellular processes and was relevant to the mechanisms of Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI) through its regulatory impact on gene expression patterns.
title: Deriving time-concordant event cascades from gene expression data: A case study for Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI)

finding: This SNP was identified in the promoter region of GHRH and was significantly associated with reduced height (effect of -0.32 standard deviations) and lower IGF-1 serum levels. It had a frequency of 0.32% in the XBI cohort.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: Associated with BMP2 and flagged as a risk SNP for sagittal non-syndromic craniosynostosis, this SNP showed significant P-values in the normal cranial vault shape GWAS, reaching study-wide significance.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: This SNP demonstrated association with BMP2 and was highlighted for its role in shaping cranial vault morphology, showing a P-value of 3.02e-14 in the GWAS, indicative of elongation and narrowing of the cranial vault.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: This intronic variant located in PTPRT was identified as being associated with IDL-Free cholesterol and IDL-phospholipids, and it was replicated in the Rotterdam study highlighting its importance in the metabolic pathways relevant to T2DM.
title: Recessive genetic effects on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a consanguineous population

finding: The SNP rs6042155 was associated with insertional mutations resulting from random integration (RI) of extrachromosomal DNA, particularly in the context of physiological doses of ionizing radiation which were shown to facilitate the process in human and mouse cells. The genetic analysis indicated that this SNP played a role in the stimulation of RI that is dependent on histone H2AX S139 phosphorylation, linking it to mechanisms of DNA damage response and highlighting its significance in cancer research and radiation risk assessment.
title: Low Dose Ionizing Radiation Strongly Stimulates Insertional Mutagenesis in a γH2AX Dependent Manner

finding: The SNP rs6100871 was identified in a study investigating spectral band requirements that improved the retrievals of Phytoplankton Functional Types (PFTs). This finding provided insight into how specific spectral bands could better capture and characterize phytoplankton communities utilizing remote sensing technology.
title: Toward a synthesis of phytoplankton community composition methods for global-scale application

finding: The SNP rs13040861 was associated with the finding that the FDA-Approved Antiviral Raltegravir inhibited fascin1-dependent invasion of colorectal tumor cells both in vitro and in vivo, indicating a significant role of fascin in cancer cell invasion and potential therapeutic implications.
title: The Actin Bundling Protein Fascin Promotes Lung Cancer Growth and Metastasis by Enhancing Glycolysis and PFKFB3 Expression

finding: This SNP was highlighted in the study as part of a notable locus involving several genes that may interact to affect volumetric imaging derived phenotypes, contributing to understanding the genetic architecture of brain structure.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs4911348 was identified as an example of a gene where paternal and maternal eQTL effects were opposite in direction for the expression of the gene NECAB3. While the genotype did not associate with the phenotype, both paternal and maternal alleles showed significant associations, reflecting the complexity of parent-of-origin effects.
title: Abundant Parent-of-origin Effect eQTL in Humans: The Framingham Heart Study

finding: This SNP demonstrated positive regulatory activity for the TUBB1 gene only under HCort exposure, showcasing its role as a putative interactive eQTL in response to stress.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: The SNP rs77351827 was strongly linked to the structural variant PD_DEL_chr20_597, which was a 1.95kb intronic deletion within intron three of the gene LRRN4. This structural variant was validated and found to have a high LD with rs77351827 (r2=0.89, D'=0.95), indicating a potential causal relationship for Parkinson's disease risk.
title: Genome-wide analysis of Structural Variants in Parkinson’s Disease using Short-Read Sequencing data

finding: As a GWAS peak SNP linked to colorectal cancer, the functional implications of rs4925386 were highlighted through its interaction with multiple physicians.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The rs867186 SNP, which encodes a protein C receptor involved in coagulation, was associated with seven phenotypes, including myocardial infarction and various hematological traits, across multiple populations.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The variant rs3918249 was identified at the MMP9 locus and was significant as a cis pQTL, suggesting its influence on MMP-9 protein abundance.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: At the RBM38 locus for mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH), the PIP for rs737092 improved from 0.72 to 0.96 when incorporating the Blood-cV2F score. This variant was implicated by MPRA data-driven features and blood-specific ABC, cCRE, and Enformer features. It was linked to the RBM38 gene, known for its role in terminal erythroid differentiation and hemoglobin regulation.
title: A consensus variant-to-function score to functionally prioritize variants for disease

finding: The variant rs80311618 was located in a myeloid-specific enhancer linked to CEBPB and was found to be associated with monocyte count, supported by a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP > 10%) for genetic variants related to this trait.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: This SNP on CHRNA4 had been previously associated with smoking cessation and was confirmed as a GWS locus in the larger dataset used in this study.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs2273535 was identified as a sex-biased <italic>cis</italic>-eQTL for the gene <italic>AURKA</italic> in skeletal muscle, demonstrating a significant association with increased <italic>AURKA</italic> expression in males (p = 9.02×10<sup>−27</sup>), but not in females (p = 0.75). This finding was highlighted in the context of its involvement in multiple cancers and muscle differentiation.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs3197744 in the 3' UTR of SIRPA was found to be significant for the amount of platelets, showing a direct link between this genetic variant and platelet levels.
title: SIRPα controls CD47-dependent platelet clearance in mice and humans

finding: The rs374587283-CPNE1 cis-eQTL was significant across five fibroblast types and demonstrated a significant SNP-cell type interaction, indicating its role in the differential expression of CPNE1 reliant on cell type.
title: Single cell eQTL analysis identifies cell type-specific genetic control of gene expression in fibroblasts and reprogrammed induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: Variant rs16991615 in the MCM8 gene was associated with lower age-adjusted inverse normal AMH levels by 0.26 SD per allele (95% CI [0.18, 0.34], P=3.48×10−10) in pre-menopausal women. This variant had previously been linked to age at menopause, suggesting a connection between AMH levels and reproductive lifespan.
title: Genome-wide association study of anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women of late reproductive age and relationship with genetic determinants of reproductive lifespan

finding: The rs2248137 SNP was associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) susceptibility and showed colocalization with a cis-mQTL effect for cg14595058, located upstream of the CYP24A1 gene. This strong evidence of colocalization suggested that the same haplotype influences both MS susceptibility and local DNA methylation.
title: Impact of genetic susceptibility to multiple sclerosis on the T cell epigenome: proximal and distal effects

finding: Associated with brain connectivity measurements, suggesting regulatory effects on neurobiological traits due to the presence of Neandertal-derived alleles.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: Part of the SNPs found at high frequencies in Papuans, this SNP showed a positive association among ancestral populations, reflecting local adaptation effects.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: For rs2618566, this SNP was pinpointed in a distal regulatory region linked to RRBP1, with a PIP of 1.00, indicating it is highly likely causal. This SNP has been identified as a liver eQTL and its presence in carriers of rare coding variants for RRBP1 was associated with significantly lower LDL-C levels. Additionally, knockdown experiments in mice confirmed that reduced RRBP1 levels led to disrupted lipid homeostasis and lower circulating LDL-C levels.
title: Systematic elucidation of genetic mechanisms underlying cholesterol uptake

finding: Identified in the MAVS gene, this SNP was unique to donor 122, contributing to the genetic mechanisms promoting resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: The rs844881 variant in the 3' UTR of the lncRNA LINC00656 in Neutrophils significantly impacted the expression of THBD, CD93, and LINC00656. This SNP was strongly linked to the development of varicose veins, implicating its effect in thrombosis via altered THBD expression.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The SNP rs3787184, located in an intron of NFATC2, was associated with varicose veins (VVs) with a P-value of 2.51×10^-36.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs13040595 was associated with differential responses in Natural Killer (NK) cell functionality, which was crucial for enhancing the efficacy of CAR-based therapies. This finding indicated that the genetic variation impacted the potency of NK cells in tumor clearance, effectively linking the SNP to improved outcomes in solid tumor models.
title: Augmenting CAR NK cell Anti-tumor Activity by Synapse Tuning

finding: The SNP rs4813319, associated with the gene SHPS1 (SIRPA), was found to have a causal role in the pathogenesis of schizophrenia. This finding was replicated in the UK Biobank data, confirming its significance in relation to schizophrenia risk.
title: Proteome-by-phenome Mendelian Randomisation detects 38 proteins with causal roles in human diseases and traits

finding: Association was found between rs1358782 and the Ribose 5-Phosphate gsQTL in astrocytes, related to the pentose phosphate pathway. The nominal p-value for this association was 7.29×10^-5.
title: gsQTL: Associating genetic risk variants with gene sets by exploiting their shared variability

finding: The lead i-rQTL variant rs1711194 was identified as influencing a monocyte-specific i-rQTL effect on the DNTTIP1-202 isoform. This variant was located downstream of the gene and alterations played a role in cellular specificity.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: SNP rs7679 exhibited a large negative effect for Very Large HDL and a large positive effect for Small HDL, despite the traits being positively correlated, confirming its unique role in lipid metabolism.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis by Iterative Hard Thresholding

finding: The SNP rs143384 located in the GDF5 gene was identified with a significant association to knee pain, demonstrating a P value of 1.32 × 10^-12. It was replicated in multiple cohorts, with a final P value of 4.64 × 10^-18 in the joint meta-analysis, indicating a strong link to knee pain, most likely due to its role in osteoarthritis.
title: A genome-wide association study identifies that the GDF5 and COL27A1 genes are associated with knee pain in UK Biobank (N = 171, 516)

finding: The SNP rs2740210 was similarly linked to an increased risk of depression in pregnant women with a history of early abuse. This finding emphasized the role of oxytocin system polymorphisms in the modulation of emotional and psychological responses related to adverse early life experiences.
title: Natural variation in oxytocin receptor signaling causes widespread changes in brain transcription: a link to the natural killer gene complex

finding: The SNP rs115287948 was identified as a missense variant in the SIRPA gene, linked to the expression of the SIRPB1 gene in humans. It demonstrated a strong association with gene expression in muscle and fibroblast tissues across both species, showcasing conservation of functional effects and presenting a compelling model for gene regulation studies.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: The lead SNP rs6074022 was associated with MS and colocalized with CD40 expression in both cortex and whole blood tissues, showing significant involvement in the inflammatory response linked to viral mechanisms.
title: Identification and catalogue of viral transcriptional regulators in human diseases

finding: The SNP rs13040826 was associated with CXCR4 and analyzed in the context of its role in acute myeloid leukemia (AML). Findings from the transcriptomic data indicated that CXCR4 positive AML cells, which are related to chemosensitivity, co-expressed genes involved in chemoresistance and maintained a blast-like state. This suggests that the SNP may play a role in the expression of CXCR4 and potentially influence patient responses to treatments.
title: CXCL12 chemokine dimer signaling modulates acute myelogenous leukemia cell migration through altered receptor internalization

finding: The SNP rs13040922 was linked to the detection of tumor-associated membrane receptors on extracellular vesicles from non-small cell lung cancer patients in a study published in 2021. This finding highlighted the potential of this SNP in enhancing the sensitivity of diagnostic methods for early cancer detection by utilizing immuno-PCR techniques.
title: Colocalization of Cancer Associated Biomarkers on Single Extracellular Vesicles for Early Cancer Detection

finding: The SNP rs3827066 was associated with increased expression of CTSA following stimulation with either sLPS or LIL10. This association was evident as it co-localized with the CAD-associated risk locus, suggesting that the risk allele may disrupt a regulatory element of CTSA. This disruption was hypothesized to lead to elevated oxidative stress and increased risk of cardiovascular diseases, including CAD and AAA.
title: Gene expression QTL mapping in stimulated iPSC-derived macrophages provides insights into common complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs6031298 was associated with ALDH gene expression, specifically implicating a role in the progression of prostate cancer through enhancing the metastatic potential of cancer stem cells (CSCs). This finding was derived from research indicating that matrix metalloproteinases, which are regulated by ALDH genes, play a significant role in prostate cancer pathology.
title: The distinct role of ALDH1A1 and ALDH1A3 in the regulation of prostate cancer metastases

finding: The SNP rs6060369 was associated with height, as reported by several large genome-wide association studies (GWAS). This indicates a significant finding in the context of height traits.
title: Leveraging allelic heterogeneity to increase power of association testing

finding: The SNP rs1800961 was related to HDL (high-density lipoprotein), with its association confirmed by both large GWAS and meta-analysis studies, making it a robust finding.
title: Leveraging allelic heterogeneity to increase power of association testing

finding: In the study conducted by Kaarijarvi et al. (2021), rs13040692 was connected to the molecular and functional links between neurodevelopmental processes and treatment-induced neuroendocrine plasticity in prostate cancer progression. The findings indicated that this SNP played a role in the adaptive changes in cancer behavior.
title: A novel role for Neurog2 in MYCN driven neuroendocrine plasticity of prostate cancer

finding: The LBP variant D283G (rs2232607) had evidence of negative selection, indicating its potential role in immune response regulation.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The minor C-allele of rs6123471 was associated with a higher HRV in humans. Mutations in the gene KIAA1755, which this SNP is located in, resulted in higher HRV at both 2 and 5 days post-fertilization (dpf) in zebrafish, suggesting that this locus's association with HRV may explain its potential link with heart rate.
title: Translating GWAS-identified loci for cardiac rhythm and rate using an in vivo image- and CRISPR/Cas9-based approach

finding: The SNP rs13041834, located near CYP24A1 on 20q13.2, was associated with higher vitamin D levels and serum calcium, linking it to nephrolithiasis risk.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: The SNP rs6120849 near EDEM2 demonstrated a decrease in frequency of the light allele that exceeded what could be attributed to changes in ancestry, indicating selection pressures may have influenced this change.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs13040739 was associated with findings related to histone modifications and gene regulation in lung cancer cells. The research indicated that Metformin treatment significantly reduced the levels of histone H3K4me3 at the promoter regions of positive cell cycle regulatory genes. This modification at the promoter regions influenced gene expression, which was directly relevant to the chromatin accessibility and transcription levels impacted by SWI/SNF activity, highlighting a connection between this SNP and chromatin remodeling processes.
title: Global identification of direct SWI/SNF targets reveals compensation by EP400

finding: The SNP rs13040715 was associated with the regulation of prostate cancer (PCa) stem cells and the adaptive molecular mechanisms in response to anti-androgen therapy. The significant finding indicated that this SNP variant could influence the treatment resistance seen in PCa.
title: Identification of a Micropeptide Linked to Cancer Stem Cell Regulation and Chemoresistance

finding: The SNP rs6090584, which is an intronic variant within EYA2, was involved in the perturbation of NCOA3 expression during the CRISPRi screen in hFOBs. This perturbation was deemed relevant in the context of osteoblast maturation and mineralization.
title: GWAS-informed data integration and non-coding CRISPRi screen illuminate genetic etiology of bone mineral density

finding: This SNP was recognized among previously significant variants related to phenotypical understanding of 25OHD levels.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: There was very strong evidence for selection at rs619865 in the ASIP gene, with an estimated selection coefficient (s) of approximately 0.10. This SNP was demonstrated to be significantly associated with freckling and hair pigmentation, showing concentrated selection within the last ~5,000 years.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs13040736 was documented to influence the invasion strategies of neuroblastoma via regulation by the extracellular matrix. This conclusion came from research conducted by Gavin et al. (2021), demonstrating its critical role in tumor invasion processes.
title: Tumour growth: Bayesian parameter calibration of a multiphase porous media model based on in vitro observations of Neuroblastoma spheroid growth in a hydrogel microenvironment

finding: The rs13040870 SNP was associated with the immunoregulatory properties of CD71+ erythroid cells (CECs). The research indicated that in humans with anemia, the allele corresponding to this SNP influenced the expansion of CECs and their expression levels of arginase (ARG1 and ARG2), which in turn suppressed T-cell activity and IFN-γ production, highlighting a key role for this SNP in the regulation of immune responses in the context of anemia.
title: Potent but transient immunosuppression of T-cells is a general feature of CD71+ erythroid cells

finding: The SNP rs6020829 was linked to signaling pathways mediated by STAT3, contributing to the progression of prostate cancer. This SNP's association underscored the complex interactions of signaling pathways, particularly in relation to the proliferation of intermediate cells observed in ERG-positive tumors.
title: ERG activates a stem-like proliferation-differentiation program in prostate epithelial cells with mixed basal-luminal identity

finding: The SNP rs6098088 was associated with spatial and temporal variability in the onset of the growing season in Svalbard as measured by MODIS-NDVI satellite data. This finding related to how climate variables influenced plant phenology, particularly in the context of changing environmental conditions due to warming temperatures in the Arctic.
title: Towards rainy high Arctic winters: how ice-encasement impacts tundra plant phenology, productivity and reproduction

finding: The rs17216707 SNP, located approximately 38kb upstream of CYP24A1, was associated with increased mean serum calcium concentrations in individuals homozygous for the increased-risk allele T compared to those with the reduced-risk allele C. The findings suggested a recessive effect, and homozygous individuals experienced more kidney stone episodes, demonstrating a correlation between this genotype and stone recurrence.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The variant c.7210G>C (rs61292917) in the CHD6 gene was predicted to have deleterious effects according to in silico analysis, and was identified as a novel HetExc variant associated with potential heterozygote advantage. Although CHD6 was not linked to any known diseases, it plays a role in influenza virus replication.
title: Hardy-Weinberg Equilibrium in the Large Scale Genomic Sequencing Era

finding: The variant rs1569960 demonstrated a strong association with SIRPA levels, with a MAF of 0.34 and a significant P-value of 2.67 × 10^-106, encompassing four independent signals in the SIRPA cis region.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: This nonsynonymous SNP on chromosome 20 was associated with increased risk of breast cancer and heavy menstrual bleeding.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: The SNP rs1015362 was associated with DNAm variation affecting pigmentation traits, specifically showing a consistent relationship with fair skin characteristics.
title: Investigating DNA methylation as a potential mediator between pigmentation genes, pigmentary traits and skin cancer

finding: The SNP rs4911414 was linked to increased DNAm at specific sites, contributing to an understanding of its role in pigmentation and skin cancer susceptibility.
title: Investigating DNA methylation as a potential mediator between pigmentation genes, pigmentary traits and skin cancer

finding: The SNP rs619865 was significantly correlated with multiple DNAm sites, suggesting its involvement in determining pigmentation phenotypes.
title: Investigating DNA methylation as a potential mediator between pigmentation genes, pigmentary traits and skin cancer

finding: The lead variant from the CD40 rheumatoid arthritis (RA) locus rs4239702 showed strong associations with multiple molecular phenotypes, particularly with the total expression level of CD40 in monocytes across four independent eQTL studies. The nominal p-values were less than 10^-4, indicating a significant association.
title: eQTL Catalogue: a compendium of uniformly processed human gene expression and splicing QTLs

finding: Colocalisation analysis with rs745307 indicated that it likely represented distinct causal variants influencing monocyte-specific eQTLs, even though this variant was associated with CD40 expression in monocytes. The low linkage disequilibrium (LD) between rs745307 and the RA GWAS lead variant rs4239702 (r^2 = 0.13) suggested that the association with RA may not stem from CD40 expression in naive monocytes.
title: eQTL Catalogue: a compendium of uniformly processed human gene expression and splicing QTLs

finding: Similar to rs192581407, this SNP was identified as a top QTL association for orotidine but on chromosome 20, demonstrating its substantial association with this metabolite.
title: yQTL Pipeline: a structured computational workflow for large scale quantitative trait loci discovery and downstream visualization

finding: The SNP rs116843836, an upstream variant of the RSPO4 gene, was also tied to MSA and IBD as part of the significant findings in the conjFDR analysis, with a conjFDR value of 0.0196. This point to a potential role of this SNP in the genetic overlap between these conditions.
title: A genome-wide genetic pleiotropy approach identified shared loci between multiple system atrophy and inflammatory bowel disease

finding: This finding related to RMI corresponded to SNP rs111968843 located in the PTPRT gene at the 20q12 region, with a p-value of 9.70×10-8.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The SNP rs6124419, which was located in intron 18 of PTPRT, replicated for both phenotypes of mild malaria attacks and infections.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The allele carriers of the female OXTR rs4813625 'C' allele showed greater stress-induced dopamine release, which was assessed as reductions in receptor availability from baseline to the pain-stress condition compared to female 'GG' homozygotes. This finding indicated the influence of this SNP on dopaminergic pathways in response to stress, reinforcing sex-specific responses influenced by genetic factors.
title: The Creative Mind: Blending Oxytocinergic, Dopaminergic and Personality

finding: SNP rs362584, located within the SNAP-25 gene, was associated with cognitive ability and interaction with rs1815739 showed significant synergistic effects in athlete recognition, marking it as a key finding in identifying gymnastic talent.
title: Detection of epistasis between ACTN3 and SNAP-25 with an insight towards gymnastic aptitude identification

finding: The SNP rs6079582, located at 20p12.1 on the gene body of MACROD2, showed consistent genetic association signals across both adults and adolescents with p-values of 1e-29 (discovery), 1.7e-18 (replication in UK Biobank), and 4.6e-8 (replication in ABCD study). This locus was noted for overlapping with genetic loci related to Autism and general cognitive ability. MACROD2 was also implicated in education attainment and adventurous personality traits. Its association signals indicated strong regional enrichment in the cerebellum white matter, linking it to motor functions, supported by knockout mouse experiments showing motor-coordination defects.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association studies on the tissue compartments of human brain identify novel loci underpinning brain development and neuropsychiatric outcomes

finding: The variant rs197819 was associated with an excess of FGR haplotypes, as demonstrated by the simulation study where it formed part of a specific signal on Chromosome 20. The SURFBAT method showed improved precision in identifying the association signal closer to rs197819, contrasting with traditional GWAS methods which detected significant signals up to 0.5Mb away from the variant. This finding was significant in the context of Brugada syndrome, highlighting rs197819's potential relevance in this phenotype.
title: SURFBAT: a surrogate family-based association test building on large imputation reference panels

finding: The SNP rs1186715161 was reported as a homozygous frameshift variant resulting in a predicted complete knockout of the HAO1 gene in a healthy adult female. Despite this predicted knockout, clinical evaluations showed normal urine and plasma oxalate levels, but plasma glycolate levels were significantly elevated (171 nmol/mL which is 12 times higher than the normal upper limit). This finding was crucial in demonstrating that complete absence of HAO1 function may not lead to adverse clinical phenotypes, supporting its potential as a drug target for treating Primary Hyperoxaluria Type 1 (PH1).
title: Deep phenotyping of a healthy human HAO1 knockout informs therapeutic development for primary hyperoxaluria type 1

finding: The SNP rs6042718 was associated with phytoplankton biomass dynamics in coastal waters, specifically within the Strait of Malacca. This finding corroborated the observations made regarding seasonal cycles, interannual variations, and decadal-scale trends in phytoplankton biomass which influenced microbial community dynamics in environments like the Singapore Strait, where environmental factors shaped the microbial compositions significantly.
title: Temporal dynamics of Bacteria, Archaea and protists in equatorial coastal waters

finding: The SNP rs150246290, located in the MACROD2 locus on chromosome 20, demonstrated genome-wide significance in the subgroup of patients with transposition of the great arteries (TGA) with an odds ratio of 3.78 (p=1.27×10−10).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs149890280, also found in the MACROD2 region on chromosome 20, exhibited genome-wide significance in TGA patients with an odds ratio of 3.74 (p=1.8×10−10).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs149467721 in the MACROD2 locus on chromosome 20 showed genome-wide significance in the TGA subgroup with an odds ratio of 3.53 (p=1.39×10−9).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs77094733 on chromosome 20, within the MACROD2 locus, reached genome-wide significance in TGA patients with an odds ratio of 3.53 (p=1.73×10−9).
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs490514 was validated in the CHD population, supporting the validity of the genetic findings reported, though it was not part of the main SNP set identified.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The variant rs16991615 located in MCM8 (p.E341K) was identified as one of the single variants likely to be causal in one of the risk-associated signals. It was among 34/205 signals that showed high posterior probability for being causal.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: Discovered as a novel locus, rs11908600 was linked to the gene STK4, revealing new insights into genetic contributions to mental illness.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: This heterogeneous locus with lead SNP rs11696888 was identified on chromosome 20, with implications for bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: This insertion/deletion variant was found to have divergent effects on bipolar disorder and schizophrenia, highlighting its significance in understanding complex psychiatric traits.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The interaction involving rs6090392 (with CHAT rs10776585) was significantly associated with age at onset (AAO) of daily smoking, highlighting potential genetic interplay affecting smoking initiation.
title: Gene-Gene interactions and pleiotropy in the brain nicotinic pathway associated with the heaviness and precocity of tobacco smoking among outpatients with multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs67002563 showed a genome-wide significant non-additive association with red blood cell distribution width (P = 2.99 x 10^-11), despite not reaching significance under additivity (P = 0.000152). It was linked with the ITPA gene, implicated in red blood cell disorders.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The non-additive signal associated with red blood cell distribution width was fine-mapped to rs1127354, a non-synonymous variant known to predict drug-induced anaemia among chronic HCV patients. This marked it as a significant finding in the context of non-additive trait variation.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs13040890 was identified in the context of research investigating SHIP1 and SHIP2 roles in cancer. The study emphasized the importance of these inositol phosphatases in cellular processes that may extend to understanding diseases like Opsismodysplasia, which involves bone mineralization and actin cytoskeleton remodeling. The findings highlighted the relevance of this SNP in the broader context of cancer biology and its association with manipulation of signaling pathways related to SHIP2.
title: SHIP2 controls matrix mineralization by regulation of the RhoA/ROCK pathway and remodeling of the actin cytoskeleton

finding: This SNP was identified in the 20q12 region and presented a new significant association following the expanded breast cancer dataset for hormone receptor status.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The rare frameshift deletion rs763014119 was associated with reduced height (-0.63 s.d.) and lower IGF-1 levels (-0.74 s.d.) in the data, with significant p-values (4.6·10<sup>-6</sup> and 4.9·10<sup>-9</sup>, respectively).
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: The study highlighted an association between the SNP rs6042049 and the regulation of the myb transcription factor. This finding was significant in the context of differentiation, cell cycle control, and oncogenesis, indicating that this specific SNP could potentially influence gene expression related to these important biological processes.
title: Impacts of nucleosome positioning elements and pre-assembled chromatin states on expression and retention of transgenes

finding: Identified as a lead SNP in the 20q12 region, correlating with significant breast cancer risk. It was also 1 Mb away from previously reported lead SNPs.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations
