finding: The SNP rs117020124 was involved in a modifiable POE-mQTL interaction that significantly affected the methylation levels of the CpG site cg18035618, with a p-value of 9.94×10^-7 in the discovery dataset and 1.42×10^-3 in the replication dataset. Current smokers exhibited a larger contrast in methylation levels between heterozygous groups of this mQTL compared with ex-smokers and never-smokers.
title: Lifestyle and Genetic Factors Modify Parent-of-Origin Effects on the Human Methylome

finding: The SNP rs117823351 demonstrated a significant interaction with the mQTL of the CpG site cg18035618 whereby the predicted mRNA expression levels of SIRT1 modified the POE on this CpG. The interaction was characterized by p-values of 3.68×10^-10 in the discovery dataset and 1.01×10^-3 in the replication dataset, indicating higher contrast in methylation levels in individuals with lower SIRT1 expression.
title: Lifestyle and Genetic Factors Modify Parent-of-Origin Effects on the Human Methylome

finding: SNP rs1800961 was identified but replaced by rs7499892 with a similar effect size when a debiasing step was applied in analyzing HDL phenotype.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs6039642, located between SNAP25, PAK7, and ANKEF1 on chromosome 20, was linked to mean cortical thickness variability. It explained 0.259% of the variance, supported by a p-value of 2.1×10^-8. This association remained significant in a healthy control subgroup.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: The locus at chr20:9940475:G:A, corresponding to rs6039642, showed a significant association with mean cortical thickness variability.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: The deletion of tssB in A. jandaei DSM 7311, relevant to SNP rs13720, was also performed, augmenting understanding of its involvement in antibacterial toxin delivery.
title: Engineering a customizable antibacterial T6SS-based platform in Vibrio natriegens

finding: This SNP was identified in the AFR sample as significantly associated with PTSD, located near BMP2, with a p-value of 3.18×10⁻⁸.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The rs6060369 variant in the R4 regulatory region of GDF5 caused statistically significant morphological changes in femoral condyles and tibial plateaus in a mouse model, along with a 30% increase in knee osteoarthritis (OA) risk, paralleling changes observed in OA patients harboring the risk allele.
title: Complex regulatory interactions at GDF5 shape joint morphology and osteoarthritis disease risk

finding: The rs4911178 variant in the GROW1 region led to alterations in acetabular and femoral neck shapes but did not affect the knee structure. This finding aligned with the phenotypes seen in developmental dysplasia of the hip (DDH) patients who carried the risk allele.
title: Complex regulatory interactions at GDF5 shape joint morphology and osteoarthritis disease risk

finding: The study validated rs6064392 as a regulatory variant impacting the CASS4 gene expression, demonstrating significant alteration in expression in THP-1 cells following its excision.
title: Functional regulatory variants implicate distinct transcriptional networks in dementia

finding: The PROCR rs867186 SNP was associated with cardiovascular risk factors and cardiovascular events, suggesting its potential relevance to heart diseases.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The alleles rs115662534(T) were implicated in disrupting the binding of transcription factors to the regulatory elements of the human CD40 gene, potentially affecting autoimmune disease processes.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: Allele rs548231435(C) was also found to disrupt transcription factor binding to regulatory elements of the CD40 gene, indicating its relevance to autoimmune diseases.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The variant rs398123017 was identified as having a large delta chi-square score (-28.7) in association with IPF. This finding indicated its potential influence on the disease, and it was previously associated with familial and sporadic melanoma and thyroid cancer. Its presence was linked to increased transcription of the TERT gene, maintaining telomerase activity, resulting in long telomeres that promote tumorigenesis.
title: Identification of Influential Variants in Significant Aggregate Rare Variant Tests

finding: The variant rs373740199 was also associated with IPF, exhibiting a delta chi-square score of -17.5. Like rs398123017, it has been implicated in familial and sporadic melanoma and thyroid cancer. It was noted that this variant likely contributes to increased transcription of the TERT gene, enhancing telomerase activity and thus contributing to tumorigenesis.
title: Identification of Influential Variants in Significant Aggregate Rare Variant Tests

finding: The SNP rs13040692 was reported in the study by Kaarijärvi et al. (2021) as having molecular and functional links to neurodevelopmental processes and the resulting neuroendocrine plasticity observed in prostate cancer progression. This finding highlighted the potential implications of neurodevelopmental genetics in influencing the behavior of prostate cancer cells, especially in the context of their clustering and migratory patterns, which were crucial aspects of the presented research.
title: Video tracking of single cells to identify clustering behaviour

finding: The SNP rs13040723 was associated with the modulation of senescence in cancer cells in the context of a study that investigated the effects of senolytics on cancer therapies. This finding related to the enhanced efficacy of drugs targeting senescent cells, particularly in how they respond to treatments that induce senescence.
title: An antibiotic that mediates immune destruction of senescent cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs77617917 was situated close to the PCIF1 gene, which encodes a phospholipid transfer protein. Similar to rs261338, it was also associated with cholesterol content in medium-sized HDLs. This association contributed to the understanding that genetic variants in this locus were linked to HDL functionality, as indicated by the direct relationship with cholesterol efflux capacity.
title: High-density lipoprotein characteristics and coronary heart disease: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The predicted damaging missense variant rs201013770 (p.Phe517Ser) in ACSS1 was associated with a mean increase in serum acetate levels of 0.005 mmol/l, indicating a potential role in metabolic regulation influenced by acetate.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The variant rs910873 was linked to melanoma risk and associated with elevated serum levels of the agouti-signaling protein (ASIP). This SNP indicated a consistent direction of effect between ASIP gene expression and protein levels.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The variant rs142951578 was identified in the <italic>NCOA3</italic> gene, specifically c.2810C>G, which resulted in a p.Ser937Cys amino acid substitution. It was predicted to be damaging by various prediction tools (SIFT score of 0.030, Polyphen2 score of 0.905), and MutationTaster2 indicated it as a disease-causing mutation with a score of 0.845. This finding was relevant to hereditary hearing loss, marking the first association of <italic>NCOA3</italic> with this condition.
title: NCOA3 identified as a new candidate to explain autosomal dominant progressive hearing loss

finding: The minor allele of the missense variant rs12481228 was associated with increased ALM in the middle-aged cohort. Predictions indicated that this SNP could be detrimental to the protein structure of CPNE1, suggesting its importance in muscle development.
title: Genome-wide associations reveal human-mouse genetic convergence and modifiers of myogenesis, CPNE1 and STC2

finding: The SNP rs6031670 was associated with a notable finding related to tumor-associated macrophages in the tumor microenvironment. This finding indicated the role of macrophages in tumor biology and underlined their significance in modulating immune responses and influencing tumor progression. The context of this finding was linked to the secretion of cytokines, which were impacted by the exposure to various pigments discussed in the study.
title: Immediate and sustained effects of cobalt and zinc-containing pigments on macrophages

finding: The SNP rs6020897, as referenced in the publication by Carpenter and Lo (2014), was found to be associated with the regulation of STAT3 target genes relevant to human cancers, specifically implicating its role in the oncogenic pathways influenced by HPV. The study elucidated that persistent HPV infection activates STAT3 through IL-6 signaling, indicating that genetic variations at this locus might influence cancer susceptibility and progression in HPV-positive cervical cancer. The understanding of the pathways involving rs6020897 provided insights into the potential therapeutic targets for this type of cancer.
title: Autocrine STAT3 activation in HPV positive cervical cancer through a virus-driven Akt - NFκB - IL-6 signalling axis

finding: The rs4911494 variant in UQCC1 was linked to reduced arm fat mass (though only reaching exome-wide significance in this depot). This finding included a trend towards reduced fat in all peripheral and subcutaneous depots, which was another significant discovery within the study.
title: Regional fat depot masses are influenced by protein-coding gene variants

finding: Zhang and Lai discussed the implications of SNP rs6031408 in the context of STAT3 signaling in cancer. It was found that this SNP plays a significant role in distinguishing the dichotomous function of STAT3, impacting tumor immunity and progression in prostate cancer.
title: Cell-autonomous GP130 activation suppresses prostate cancer development via STAT3/ARF/p53-driven senescence and confers an immune-active tumor microenvironment

finding: The rs214830_G>C variant was notably associated with skin cancer, establishing a causal relationship that indicates its role in skin development and as a potential biomarker.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The SNP rs143383 was identified as a susceptibility variant for osteoarthritis through its role in regulating the expression of GDF5. This highlighted that transacting factors influence GDF5, linking genetic variation to joint development and susceptibility to osteoarthritis.
title: A single cell transcriptional atlas of early synovial joint development

finding: The SNP rs910805 was identified as part of the largest ASD GWAS meta-analysis, which included 18,381 ASD cases and 27,969 controls. It reached a genome-wide significant marker with a p-value of 2.04 x 10^-9, indicating a strong association with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD).
title: UTMOST, A Novel Single And Cross-Tissue TWAS (Transcriptome Wide Association Study), Reveals New ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) Associated Genes

finding: The SNP rs13040713 was associated with epigenetic alterations in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) and influenced the binding of transcription factors to genomic regions relevant to cellular pathways such as ERBB and VEGF signaling. This association reflected changes in epigenetic modifiers like DNMT1 and DNMT3A, which were found to be altered in human primary TNBC tumors following treatment with eribulin, and highlighted the potential role of this SNP in the context of TNBC treatment.
title: Alteration of DNMT1/DNMT3A by eribulin elicits global DNA methylation changes with potential therapeutic implications for triple-negative breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs143383 was identified as a susceptibility factor for osteoarthritis through its regulatory role in the expression of the GDF5 gene. This finding was original and highlighted the importance of trans-acting factors in genetic predisposition to this condition.
title: NERD-seq: A novel approach of Nanopore direct RNA sequencing that expands representation of non-coding RNAs

finding: The MMP-9 rs17576 polymorphism was investigated for its association with susceptibility to Type 2 diabetes, solidifying the connection between matrix metalloproteinases and diabetes pathogenesis.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs3746444 within miR-499a was associated with breast cancer risk in the Iranian population, highlighting its potential relevance in cancer genetics.
title: Circulating MicroRNAs indicative of sex and stress in the European seabass (Dicentrarchus labrax): toward the identification of new biomarkers

finding: The CHRNA4 gene polymorphisms rs1044396 and rs1044397 were linked to Parkinson's disease symptoms and smoking behaviors, indicating their dual role in neurodegenerative disease pathology.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: For rs6053810, the findings from GWAS analysis indicated a significant association with the phenotype 'CaffeineConsumption'. The analysis divided samples into case and control cohorts based on caffeine consumption levels, resulting in p-values that determined the genetic influence on caffeine metabolism.
title: Towards a new standard in genomic data privacy: a realization of owner-governance

finding: The SNP rs6031615 was linked to the role of EBV-encoded RNAs in viral pathogenesis. It contributed to understanding the mechanisms by which EBV manipulates the host's immune response, particularly in how it modulates type I IFN pathways and influences cytokine production during acute infection.
title: Multiple viral microRNAs regulate interferon release and signaling early during infection with Epstein-Barr virus

finding: The SNP rs2281285 within PDYN was associated with alcohol dependence and propensity to drink in negative emotional states, as multiple studies demonstrated its significance in alcohol use behavior.
title: Genome-wide association mapping of ethanol sensitivity in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The SNP rs13042395 in the SLC52A3 gene was identified as a biomarker for regional lymph node metastasis and relapse-free survival in patients with esophageal squamous cell carcinoma. This finding indicated that the presence of this SNP could be crucial in understanding metastatic behavior in cancer.
title: Identification of key genes and associated pathways in neuroendocrine tumors through bioinformatics analysis and predictions of small drug molecules

finding: In the context of IBD, the study found that patients with the HNF4A-AA genotype had significantly lower ileal ACE2 levels compared to those with the C-allele (HNF4A-AC or HNF4A-CC genotypes), with a p-value of 2.8E-02. This indicates a relationship between the HNF4A genotype and ACE2 expression specifically in the inflamed ileum. However, colonic ACE2 expression was not influenced by the HNF4A genotype, as evidenced by a p-value of 6.7E-01.
title: Intestinal receptor of SARS-CoV-2 in inflamed IBD tissue is downregulated by HNF4A in ileum and upregulated by interferon regulating factors in colon

finding: The SNP rs13040725 was associated with the regulation of cofilin-1, a protein implicated in the promotion of pancreatic cancer. This finding indicated that variations at this SNP could influence the molecular mechanisms underlying tumor progression, contributing to insights into cancer biology and potential therapeutic targets.
title: Data-driven inference of Boolean networks from transcriptomes to predict cellular differentiation and reprogramming

finding: The SNP rs6031769 was identified in the context of drug resistance in cancer, specifically highlighting its implications in the ability of tumors to adapt and resist therapeutic interventions. The study suggested that variations at this locus could play a significant role in the phenotypic expression related to drug resistance, indicating a connection between genetic mutations and treatment outcomes in cancer pathology.
title: Extent and context dependence of pleiotropy revealed by high-throughput single-cell phenotyping

finding: Signal rs191830490 at the HNF4A locus had liver TOA scores of 0.40 and islet TOA scores of 0.31, suggesting a shared regulatory role with implications for T2D.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: At the HNF4A locus, the secondary signal rs76811102 had islet TOA scores of 0.32, and its contributions to multiple tissues indicate shared functional roles related to T2D risk.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6042155 was identified in the context of oropharyngeal squamous carcinomas (OPSCC) associated with HPV infection. In this study, it was found that genomic instability was influenced by the integration of the virus into the host genome, and that this specific SNP may be related to the mechanisms of viral carcinogenesis and DNA damage. Additionally, tumors with integrated virus showed greater genomic instability compared to those with only episomal viruses, which ties back to the findings surrounding tumorigenicity and patient outcomes.
title: Genome Instability Precedes Viral Integration in Human Papilloma Virus Transformed Tonsillar Keratinocytes

finding: The SNP rs6031769 was identified within a context relating to mutations that confer resistance to various cancer treatments. It was found to have immunogenic potential as predicted in silico across a significant proportion of the human population, suggesting its relevance in developing therapeutic cancer vaccines. Furthermore, it was supported by prior experimental validation indicating that associated neopeptides elicited T-cell responses in vitro, emphasizing the potential of this SNP in precision immunotherapy.
title: The immunogenic potential of recurrent cancer drug resistance mutations: an in silico study

finding: The SNP rs8121031 was associated with phenotypic traits related to plant height and growth rate in wheat. The study evaluated the performance of different wheat cultivars in both pure and mixed stands, revealing that certain genotypes had higher mean yields in mixtures compared to others. This finding was significant in understanding the relationship between the SNP and the phenotypic plasticity observed in the contrasting genotypes related to yield components and tillering dynamics.
title: Contrasted phenotypic plasticities of life-history traits in interacting plants: case of pure versus mixed stands of wheat

finding: The SNP rs4810485 at the CD40 locus had a significant association with Multiple Sclerosis (MS) susceptibility, as indicated by its correlation with alternative splicing of CD40 transcripts. Specifically, this SNP was linked to the relative upregulation of a splice isoform that lacks exon 5, resulting in lower expression of CD40 on the cell surface. Furthermore, individuals carrying this susceptibility SNP exhibited lower levels of the anti-inflammatory cytokine IL-10 in their peripheral blood. This suggests that the genetic modulation of CD40 expression via alternative splicing may elevate MS risk, although the precise mechanism for this association was still being investigated. Additionally, previous studies highlighted the pathogenic role of CD40 in MS, with variations at this locus being directly tied to disease susceptibility.
title: Summary-data-based mendelian randomisation reveals druggable targets for multiple sclerosis
